The ‚Äúventure‚Äù feature is amazing and unique for these types of apps. It allows you to search guys in any area around the entire world. If you plan on traveling, I definitely suggest utilizing this feature to meet guys online before you arrive. This enables you to meet potential date, no matter what intent, and allows you to learn about the good spots friendly to our sexuality!  I did this when traveling several times, and all I can say is I was very happy and fortunate to have this app. I believe you can get a free trial before upgrading to ‚ÄúPro‚Äù, which will allow you to familiarize yourself with Scruff, and realize why upgrading is not only the best route, but is fair in features and price. They try to constantly out-do themselves, and will even ask for your opinion or suggestions on any potential changes, but it‚Äôs unlikely as this app provides just about everything!  Xoxo

review: Scruff is just Grindr on steroids for some reason. People talk about Grindr guys being creepy and awful, but at least you deal with a wide variety of men. This app just has the worst of the awful guys, the lowest of the low in our community; it‚Äôs disgusting. This app is geared towards ‚Äòmasculine‚Äô men, although it claims to be inclusive (more on that below), so you get all the toxic masculinity that comes along with it. I have been using this app for about 5 years and I‚Äôve only hooked up twice from it for the first time this year. I‚Äôm not going to pretend to be a stud, but I‚Äôve always had much better luck on Grindr. It‚Äôs only because the personalities of the guys on Scruff make me want to vomit so I lose interest quickly. Even if just for a quick hook up, it‚Äôs still not worth it. The app allows you to write more stuff on your profile than Grindr does, which makes some guys write entire essays about their likes and dislikes and that‚Äôs where you start seeing all the racism, and internalized homophobia even more. I could go on for hours writing about the kind of guys that get on the app, but it‚Äôs clear they only cater to a very particular audience. The app claims to be inclusive and what not, but even the staff is prejudiced. It‚Äôs clear that the good reviews mostly come from the same people who contribute the worst our community has to offer. To top it all off, the same guys will message you on Grindr, but not on Scruff. It makes no sense.
title: Grindr on steroids

developerResponse: {'id': 3518424, 'body': 'Your feedback and suggestions are very important. We have communicated your feedback regarding additional blocks to the product team for consideration as we plan future improvements. WOOF!', 'modified': '2018-05-18T18:21:03Z'}
review: The developer needs to learn that a feature may be working as designed, but if it doesn‚Äôt work the way their customers want it to, it‚Äôs not working correctly.  Paid version only allows a maximum of 2000 blocks and hides, because (according to Scruff support), more than that causes app performance to degrade unacceptably.  Other dating apps have solved this problem, but Scruff support were adamant that it‚Äôs not a problem and therefore they are not going to change how this works.  Instead, they directed me to use their search feature, which also isn‚Äôt as robust as it could be, and doesn‚Äôt solve the problem I have, which is that the only way to get different guys to show up in my feed is to block or hide the ones who are already shown (so that there is room for other profiles to be displayed).  Again the answer from Scruff support was ‚Äúthis is working as designed and we‚Äôre not going to change it.‚Äù  These answers would be unacceptable from the company I work for, and pretty much any other company I‚Äôve encountered. This developer needs to learn that their paying customers are their most important customers, and the customer is always right.  Again, ‚Äúworking as designed‚Äù is not the same as ‚Äúworking correctly‚Äù if it‚Äôs not working how your customers want it to.
title: Rude support, not responsive to customer requests

title: Getting prudish?

review:
Scruff was one of the best gay social apps and hookup sites, but they don‚Äôt seek to serve that community. They aspire to be something else. 

The latest step?  Banning all profile photos of men in... bathing suits. Boxer shorts. Underwear. Leather jocks. 

You can wear it on Instagram or Folsom Street. Wear it to the beach or poolside. Wear it to one of the parties Scruff ceaselessly promotes. But not on Scruff. 

What are the values they are promoting, exactly?  A culture of shame. We‚Äôre all just heteronormative buff guys in sweaters and jeans. Nothing to see here.

Don‚Äôt bother. You‚Äôve already got the newly sanitized, anti-male Tumblr and the relatively libertine Instagram.
title: Scruff isn‚Äôt what you think

review:
Thought I‚Äôd give a new review. Old one is further below. 

Current version works well enough. 
New feature of going straight to chat, I‚Äôm not a fan. Would really like to see who sent the message first. Then decide whether to read it. 
I feel this app is missing out on an opportunity, a BFF feature. All this time during the lockdown, people had a difficult time meeting up. It was difficult for making new friends as well. Many felt isolated. How wonderful it would have been to have a social/make new friends section similar to Bumble‚Äôs BFF.  That feature for them is all the craze right now. I know I‚Äôm enjoying it. 
Anyway my two cents worth. 
Also, how does one become an ambassador? I see this all the time. Not sure what that feature is about. 

‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
Even though it‚Äôs one of the better apps, it keeps trying to be grindr. Which is a horrible app. The uptake in adds is sad. I get it. You need make money, but it can be done in a less intrusive way. Lose a star The new Beta Bear mode is a why would you want to narrow down your clientele like that. It already mostly swinger bears. Will there be an otter mode, swingers mode, looking for just friends mode etc. and what steep price will you ask for it? It‚Äôs the same local people over and over. Yawn. Its also the same people in all the other categories. It‚Äôs a finite clientele. I‚Äôve been in this app since it first appeared. And it‚Äôs quite pricy. Yikes! Part of me just says ‚Äòwhy?‚Äô. People would actually pay to see the same 100, 200 guys in there feed on a daily basis. Lose a star.
title: It‚Äôs a finite clientele

developerResponse: {'id': 17704317, 'body': 'We appreciate the feedback, and we\'d love to hear from you personally. You can navigate to the Settings menu within SCRUFF and select "Contact SCRUFF Support", or submit a ticket to our support team by visiting support.scruff.com. WOOF!', 'modified': '2020-09-16T15:33:12Z'}
review:
First off every time they update the app it becomes less appealing! It is nothing like it use to be and a lot of great features have been taken away. Secondly, if you aren‚Äôt in your 20s or have an Adonis body be ready to have your pics scrutinized by their moderators! I submitted a picture that shows barely 2‚Äù of underwear fabric just above a mirror frame and it was rejected. When I contested it through there customer support, which is what you‚Äôre directed to do if you feel it‚Äôs rejected in error, I was dismissed and told never to use support again unless it‚Äôs serious. I sent pictures along with my complaint of other approved profiles with guys full body underwear pictures, semi-hard, full outlines and pubic hair showing but of cours about 10 years younger and off the cover of a magazine or clearly packing a monster. I was told to go report them, not the point! I even went as far to reach out to both Eric Silverburg and Johnny Skandros themselves about their customer support and bias handling with their policies, nothing. I‚Äôve never reached out to the CEO and founders of a business and had them act as if they could care less about their paying customers. I‚Äôve been a member since Scruffs infancy and a paying member for most of it. About to lose one more for poor customer service, all for absolutely ridiculous reasons!

***UPDATE***The response to the issue of poor customer support is to contact customer support about customer support. I some how don‚Äôt thank Daniel O is going to do anything about his own customer service skills or correct the issue I‚Äôve already contacted him multiple times about. Why should he care to act any different when the CEO and founder seem to not care and this is the kind of response that a bad review gets on the App Store?

developerResponse: {'id': 10214925, 'body': 'We appreciate the feedback. Due to security enhancements on our network and device improvements, the current version of SCRUFF installed on your device is no longer supported. We apologize for the inconvenience. WOOF!', 'modified': '2019-08-17T21:08:44Z'}
review:
Scruff keeps pushing me to update, constantly throwing up ads that force me over to the App Store and even going as far as disabling photo viewing (even though I'm a premium member and therefore paying for the right to view photos). The problem, however, is that Scruff version 6.0 requires you have iOS 11.0 on your phone and that iOS is not available on the iPhone 5 (which I have) or older versions of the iPhone. Therefore, I have to choose between  buying a new phone so I can use all of the premium benefits on Scruff or terminating my premium membership. I'm going to terminate my premium membership. I like Scruff but it's not worth throwing down $600-$900 on a new phone just to keep using it, and if I can't use all of the premium benefits then there is no point in paying for a premium membership.

 I have already contacted support, explained that I kept getting pop up messages demanding I upgrade to Scruff 6.0 and that I couldn't do that because the required iOS is not available for my iPhone. I also mentioned that I could not see any photo galleries. Their only response was "Well you need to update to Scruff 6.0." 

What?!? I just told you I can't update to Scruff 6.0 and your response is to tell me I should update to Scruff 6.0?

This used to be a great app, but this is just messed up. I guess I will terminate my Pro membership and stop using Scruff if this is how it's going to be. I can't afford a new phone right now and I certainly couldn't justify the expense solely to keep using Scruff
title: Latest update is unavailable for older iPhones

review:
Unfortunately, their new picture decency ‚Äúpolicy‚Äù makes them very big hypocrites. I was flagged for having a picture in a pair of boxer brief trunks cut mid-thigh length; very model like, classy and hardly distasteful. They sited this as being in violation of their new underwear ‚Äúpolicies‚Äù but allow plenty of other guys to post speedo and speedo looking underwear pics - far skimpier; and they are not flagged. They are not removed. If Scruff is going to have such a stringent new bikini briefs and speedo policy they need to triple the enforcement of it - why do some guys get to keep pics up in their briefs while removing others? And who decides? Algorithms? Someone at a desk in India? This is a very troublesome new policy. Let‚Äôs not even get started on how slow, robotic and disingenuous their Support structure is. 

Then, I replace the photo with a shirtless bathroom mirror selfie. Nothing hanging ‚Äúout‚Äù and nothing creeping - and they again remove it. No specific reason. No notification. They just take my photo off. Again, who decides who‚Äôs picture goes and who‚Äôs can stay? Even more troublesome is if it‚Äôs a human being behind a desk why does he/she keep some user‚Äôs pics while others must go. Completely hypocritical with a biased sense of subjectivity. 

If you are a paid Pro member you get treated like this - Support is not in a hurry to get back to me. Nor would I imagine they really would be. All I got was a canned form letter telling me they‚Äôre ‚Äúon it‚Äù.  Sure. 

I cancelled my paid  Pro membership subscription and will remove my profile contents shortly. I‚Äôm sorry it has to end this way; but if this is how they treat paying, subscribing customers then I want no part. My hard earned dollar will go to Bro or Grindr.

review: I updated the minute the new versions became available. The new features were a great improvement in my opinion. As I am already a Pro member, I was not aware of all the restrictions that have been placed on non-paying members. I read through the other reviews and think that something needs to be done, but since it doesn't directly apply to me, I hesitate to get on a soap box. It would just be a shame to make a connection on the app, only to discover that I can't use any of the features I already pay for because the other person doesn't pay. As for the interface, I think it's fine. It's familiar. The only feature I still think needs to be added is an indicator on a member's profile (like coloring the button orange like the unlock icon) showing that you have woofed at a person before. If you decide to woof at then again, it would also be nice if the confirmation dialog could tell you when you last woofed. It is impossible to go through your list if "Woof'd At"s to check this out. Still think this app is moving in the right direction; maybe just needs to work out a few kinks.

review:
Scruff seems to just be getting better and better! The new additions are great! "Most woofed in the last hour" a great way to meet good looking guys all over the world. That's just one of the new items added, so many new little short cuts that make this app so much better than any of the competition. The attitude of the guys seem to be getting better and a little more likely to respond than other apps even if not interested. Important to have in a really successful app for it to do its best in getting guys to meet each other. It's not always about a hook up. It can be a conversation that leads to a friendship or something of interest with that person, that then leads you to a hook up or date with someone else you find attractive that only would have happened thru that initial person. Isn't that where the best connections happen, those hard to find guys.
Does everyone have too many friends to meet any others? Having a beer with someone that you wouldn't normally have, will probably make more of a change in your prospective hook ups or dates, then the guys you see all the time. You never know who they know that may be of interest to you and vice versus.
Put yourself out there! It may change your life. It definitely won't hurt it.
title: Upgrade

review:
In the new version, you have the option to send regular resolution pics or retina quality resolution pics for 75 "credits" which is .10 cents.  The person sending the pic is charged, and if the person receiving it wants to save the pic to his camera roll, it costs another 75 credits!  Is Scruff turning into another wireless carrier? I'm all for Scruff making $$ for this app, but .20 per picture being paid between sender & receiver? Bandwidth is not that expensive!  You should only charge the person saving the received retina pic, not the person sending it! 

Also why try to play games with credits? Just make it simple to understand... 10 credits for .99 cents... Why try and hide the cost by saying 750 credits for .99 and then charge 75 credits to send a pic?  Also the extra "plus" features for $4.99 & $3.99 are too much.. I would pay a max of $2.50 each for those features.  I'm not paying $8.98 a month AND then also pay .10 to send a retina pic and .10 cents to save a received retina pic.. You will get more subscribers if you dropped each of those to $2.50/mo max, and if you subscribe to both, give maybe enough credits to send & receive 50 pics per month... Otherwise, I'm not paying for any of the extra features.
title: New v2 is too expensive!

review: The older version of scruff was pretty good and much better than other apps such as Grindr. This latest version has some needed improvements made but apparently the people at Scruff got inflated egos and WAY WAY WAY overpriced the added features that you can purchase on monthly subscription basis that make the app usable. For example if you want to see more than a few handful of subscribers pay $3.99. If you want to see a history of your conversation with someone more than the last few texts to him, pay for an additional $3.99 - really?  Two separate subscription fees - Nearly $10 per month when said and done just to make the app usable?  One flat $3.99 fee is steep but doable for most. Two subscription fees is just ridiculous!  Then on top of the fees you have to put up with advertisements - come on guys stop the money grab. Johnny Scruff's original statement about why he created the app for simply wanting connect like-minded guys has been brushed aside for corporate greed. $$$
title: Good app but WAY overpriced (not really free)

title: Who cares

review: This app is more reliable, uses less battery, has a better profile format and actually informs you when you've received a message without requiring you to go pro. Grindr has very minimal  space in their profiles and only tells you when you've got a message if you have the app open, even then it only does that maybe 75% of the time. End result, with Scruff you get to socialize more and check you phone less. Grindr seems to be more popular because it came first and it gives the illusion of having more users on the screen. If you have nothing better to do than constantly check and refresh some app for slow paced chatting/trying to meet some dude who's phone might die any minute or enjoy looking flakey and rude because you've got better things to do with your time and battery life, choose Grindr. Otherwise, choose Scruff and socialize reliably without sacrificing time and battery life and maybe meet some dandy men.
title: Way better than Grindr

review:
Scruff is hands down one of the best social networking architectures out there supporting a niche community.  This category is full of wannabes and Scruff isn't the first of its kind to be sure.  It is quite simply the best app all-around for its membership. The service is a bit pricey, I think at almost $20/month.  (I mean does that include a gym membership or what, right?  Ah, nope.) But believe it or not, that's a competitive price.  

Interestingly, I feel this category of social networking experiences may be the vanguard for how social networks evolve for the Internet as a whole.  It's worth paying attention to these niche communities and how brands like Scruff play to essentially tribal affiliations to produce both ad-sales revenue, and evergreen membership fees, that are to a great extent inoculated against encroachment by Facebook.  In the Internet echo system , this service has found a niche that may have it competing against (or being eaten up by) some much bigger players.
title: The Little Gay Web App that 'Woofed'

review: I just downloaded the latest update for Scruff. Overall I'm a fan of this app, and the new "Grids" feature is a nice improvement. But I wonder if anyone on the programming or management staff remembers that "GRID" was one of the names initially given to the disease that would eventually be known as AIDS.  It was called Gay Related Immune Deficiency, and that name reflected, in part, the ugly stigma that is still attached to that terrible plague: that gay people were somehow to blame or deserving of the suffering caused by AIDS/HIV. Now I'm not saying they should change the app or this feature, but in future upgrades and features the staff may want to consider their audience. There are, no doubt, some of our more mature scruffy brothers on the sight who lost friends to AIDS.  I know our community tends to focus on fashion in the here-and-now, but I think we could afford to reflect on our history more often, lest we forget and end up back where we were when GRID was just appearing.
title: History Lesson

review:
I've been using scruff about 4 years now, and it's hands down the best app to find other guys. It's got fantastic features and really good add value for pro members, the app is always reliable and there are never bots. Once you use Scruff it seems amazing Grindr has an user base at all. In addition to great features and reliability, the app tends to attract articulate, educated men which is another way it trumps the competition. I suppose it's a self fulfilling prophecy --scruff never limits your to 140 characters and because of that you get it all from hookups to dates. Big fan!

The new app update took some getting used to and there are some features that are now buried or hard to find at all. But they've already released an update with marked improvements and it seems like they are taking user feedback into account. Worth taking the free account for a spin and staying around for the pro features.

title: Love Scruff

review:
Scruff 5, IMO, is the best of the gay apps. They went from a really outdated version 4 (which didn't support iPhone 6 for over a year, but yet they had Apple Watch support?) to this amazing refresh which has way more functionality. Most impressive is the ability to use the app in landscape mode. The new views (who's online, most woof'd) look great. Tap and hold to instantly start a chat, ingenious!! Let's compare:

Grindr: requires a premium subscription to get basic features such as notifications, loaded with spam users, the app crashes constantly. 

Growlr: when it first arrived it was simple and fast, and at one time I was a Pro user. Now it's plagued by obtrusive ads/videos and the developers have done little to make it better. The more you use it, the more the creators are making money off you from the ads, and it's obvious. Worse, the quality of picture uploads is poor, making your first impression lacking.

Hornet: Ad placement is poor making your experience less enjoyable. You'll receive lots of annoying messages from the 'support team'. The app itself is clunky in some areas, and photo resolution changes after viewing others in the same profile.

Jack'd: Way too many complaints from users, not worth your time.

In short, Scruff has a great app and works flawlessly. I highly recommend it!
title: Perfect Update! Most Advanced Gay App

review: I've always thought Scruff was the best gay social networking app on the market, and I've tried them all. The interface, profile options, and easy communication have always been the best of any app out there. Most recent update is ok -- the new interface is more cluttered than I would like, it's less seamless to navigate between albums and profiles, and a lot of features were changed that didn't need changing, like the use of icons instead of words for some buttons. I'm disappointed with the new censorship of profiles: my profile was flagged for inappropriate context because is said NO PNP (flagged the word "PNP"). The censorship script should be more intelligent than that. And the profile text is scrunched too narrowly -- an otherwise short profile now requires lots of scrolling, and those with lots of descriptive text now have to severely cut down if anyone is going to read what they have to say. Overall still the best gay app, but not sure this update was thought out enough.
title: Best gay app, update has problems

review: I don't understand how everyone else has a super negative thing to say about Scruff?? Of all the gay apps I've tried (& I've tried quite a few), this one always seems to come thru as the best working one out there. Super easy interface & very user-friendly. Loads of hot men on here & internationally (the Venture feature is such a wonderful idea). I've met some really awesome dudes on here, a few of which I've become really good friends with! I should mention that I am a PRO user & this is the only gay app I'd ever consider paying for because it's so worth it. I'll admit, the free version can be annoying AF with the whole not being able to see all photos in an album or not being able to scroll up the message history, etc. (Took off a star for that) But @ least these guys don't play you for your money like most other popular gay apps out there do...they know very well who they are (Grindr/Jack'd/VGL/etc.)
title: I actually love this one the most

review:
I am a professional iOS developer. This update is like a parody of what I do: rather than reading and absorbing the Human Interface Guidelines, the app authors seem to have taken the stance that an app has the look and feel of the OS simply because it uses vibrancy effects and custom view controller transitions. Most of which are poorly executed with jerky frame updates in the completion block. The navigation structure is senseless; instead of proper stacking of view controllers, there are unnecessary modals with Done buttons. These are the least of its sins: the main screens for browsing have simply gone haywire with clutter and irrelevance. Icons have replaced text for no good reason in many places. The only real improvement I see is more seamless pagination.

Sadly, I suspect the following: most likely, the owner was led to believe his app required a top-down makeover and rewrite. This exercise was likely very expensive. Most of the old UI tropes could have been elegantly updated and modernized for the new OS features without so much rework. And the users (myself included) would be much happier for it.
title: Poorly conceived

review:
The interface is easy to use, and the free version offers a wide variety of options. It doesn't seem to have the issues Grindr has (delayed message notifications, etc), and unlike some apps it gives an option to interact with guys workd-wide, not just ones within a few miles of you.

 Although it's aimed at a more muscle-bear/meat and potatoes kind of guy, it doesn't come across as "exclusive". I like the option to "woof" at guys; it's a nice way to compliment a guy without being pushy or having to have a conversation. Another nice feature is the "would you meet" button. If both of you choose "maybe" or "yes", it suggests that you both initiate a conversation. It doesn't alert them if you choose "no", so both parties are spared negative perceptions.

All around, it's a great app to interact with guys who share similar interests, and potentially meet a playmate or partner.
title: Fun app, easy to use

review:
Scruff is definitely my favorite of the various gay "dating" apps, based both on the types of guys that use it (the name is appropriate) and the functionality of the app itself.  That said, the monthly $9 "subscription" is highway robbery for unlocking features that are, by and large, standard functionalities in Scruff's competitors.  I mean, having to pay to block more than 80 profiles? Or being able to see your full message history with another user?  If you're going to charge a whopping $100+ per year for a subscription, the extras you get for it oughta be AMAZING.  Conversely, if I'm paying a monthly charge for enabling a feature set that brings Scruff up to (and perhaps even a bit above) the functionality level of its competition, then the charge ought to be on par with that of the competition.

Bottom line: great app, great guys, cruddy pricing.
title: Good app, overpriced

review:
Tried most of the others, Scruff is the only one I ever bought up on. Def like all the options that brings you, filters n such.  
Also like to kind of men that navigate to the scruff way of thinking, my opinion, but I find them more masculine, mature, furry, easy on the eyes.
I've not met the man yet, but have met and chatted with some really nice men, and had some fun along the way.  Yeh, there've been some douche bags too, but I address them in my profile and can easily weed them out.  
I keep the 'G' as back up, but its more hassle, less intuitive, players, youngins and even minors.  But the 'G' seems to be the 1st app everyone gets.  I gotta cabin upstate, seems there are more men up there using the 'G', but thats fine with me.  
These apps are in business to up sale you, I'd def recommend upgrading to the Scruff Pro if your gonna upgrade at all.  Have fun, be safe....peace
title: Does what it says.

review: I used to love this app.  Now I tolerate it.  It's dated, has ridiculously overpriced "premium" features, just took away the global "likes you" setting for a tinder ripoff that is close to useless and completely inefficient.  You are continuously hounded about pro version even if you have a year long subscription.   Once, I fat fingered the dismiss menu and the app recorded two accept clicks and I now had concurrently running overpriced memberships- $160 total signed up for in three days.  Scruff was rude or nonresponsive even though I have had a pro membership since the time when they had a write and a look pro memberships... Eventually Apple sorted it out.  Meanwhile, scruff still kept hawking the pro version and displaying other ads in my "ad free" pro version.   The latest, today, is I was in a "rate this app screen" and the only button that worked was "rate us 5 stars". The cool guys gets you two, though deserve 6.  Scruff on the other hand deserves a negative digit.
title: Request for Review I Couldn't Refuse

review:
Is a pretty decent app.  One of the better ones out of all the others like it.  I do miss the feature where you were able to save the picture to either your private album or your phone/device.  The new version removed that ability.  I can understand the need for it as these are individuals pictures.  Still.  
What really sets Scruff aside from the other apps (like A4A and Grindr) is that Scruff has incorporated the 'would you be interested in meeting this person' and the extension of 'the Stack' where Scruff randomly selects profiles from the thousands around the world and you say if you would be interested or not.  If there's an indicated interest from both parties, you are alerted and it's then up to you to make contact.  

The other new features for this version of the Scruff app is the 'who's online, New Members, Who got Woofed the Most; Most Woofed New Member and Who's Online Now Globally/Locally.  Previously it was just who was online now gloves and local.  These new sections allows you to see more guys' profile than before. 

I'm still disappointed on what they're asking for the subscription amount and the limits given to those who don't subscribe.  But I'm not running the app so it's not up to me.
title: Nice app

review:
I reviewed this app yesterday as a 1 star app. Today I learned that Scruff had server issues the bulk of yesterday... So I am upping my review to 3 stars. 

This app can be fun and yes filled with lots of eye-candy but I feel that there are still way to many issues with it. 

The connectivity issues do seem to be a bit to constant for my taste. 

There also seems to be way to many steps to have to go through to see: images, messages, woofs, viewers....

This is a mobile app so I would think the idea of getting to what you needed would be a little more streamlined.

I haven't upgraded to any of the extra features and have been happy I haven't due to yesterday's outage and the constant connectivity issues. From the other reviews I am also getting the idea that they charge a bit more then any other gay social apps, how does that bode for competition? I don't understand why they are charging a fee to see your back log of chats, so maybe the other negative reviewers are correct in saying someone got greedy... Maybe they are just trying to cover their costs or maybe it's all about the Benjamins.. 

I will continue to use the free elements of this app and wait to see if the app improves or continues it's slippery slope.

If you are looking to meet, friend or whatever some men via your device this one can be fun, just don't rely on this everyday...
title: This is an Okay App

review:
This app appears to offer so much but its more trouble than its worth. Searches for the same area will give results varying from 1 person to100s of guys immediately after. When filling out settings you never know if the response should be what you are or what you are looking for. User profile does not keep even though you filled out all questions, icked save and received a message that the profile was uoloaded and saved. The next time you go on the app may remember your settings or it may not. It cant even seem to remember your user nsme correctly. 
The worst part of the app is the size of the individual thumbnails. They are so tiny that even with 20/20 vision cannot see them. You have to open the entire profile to see any pics. 
The user interface on grindr is so much easier to use and is much more sophisticated than this one. 
In addition the gugs who use scruff are just that-scruffy and in some cases dirty looking. If you like guys whose faces are a tossup between dirty and forgot to shave, you'll love this one.
title: Annoying App

review: I've enjoyed using Scruff. Guys here seem to be a little more interested in getting to know someone rather than just a quick hookup. The profile and other options such as a private album allow for a better personal description and more visuals which makes the process much easier. I prefer the paid version for sure. It's a little pricey, but overall it is much better than the free one. My only complaint would be that they have categorize that you can choose of "types" and I don't seem to fit any of them. And there isn't even an option for "other" or a unique type that you can personalize.  Overall I find it effective, and I've met many great people through Scruff. Some have become friends, some relationships, some flings.
title: Works great for me!

review: What would truly make this app better is a way to scale the font in the chat screen, for me the current font iOS Too small .  I have to cut and paste my incoming messages in an app that allows me to scale the font iOS zoom feature is clunky and too difficult to use they need to remember that there are gay guys with visual impairments,  and we do socialize and use pick up apps like this sand we even get hookups.   The. Have no area for feedback on their website or on the app.  That is a bad thing it tells me that they have no interest in what their customers have to say. I hope that is not the case and hopefully just an oversight.  Please make your app easier for those who have visual impairments font size scalability and ability to change the contrast colors very bad too especially if someone is color blind. If you are going to make an app for a community make sure it accommodates all in the community.
title: SCRUFF

review: GREAT JOB SCRUFF!  I like the update. I haven't found a gay chat/hook up app yet,that has everything,but Scruff comes the closest to it. Most important, it's seams like all the profiles are real,unlike that  other popular app, that grinds your patience to the limit because it has more fake(bot)profiles than real ones.  It's easy to navigate, and you can check out profiles of nearby guys as well as guys from around the globe. Also,you can view unlimited profiles, send woofs(hellos),upload your private photo albums, tag your friends, have instant chat, and upload any photo you want instantly and privately message it to anyone. It's great. It many more features than I'm stating,and is actually fun to use. This is the must have app. It puts all the others to shame.
title: Simply the best of the gay social apps

review:
I have to agree with alot of the reviews on here of late. When I first get Scruff, I was impressed with it, and went ahead for the option of "Going Pro" and bought a subscription.  Everything was fine, until, some extra financial difficulties forced me to relinquish my "Pro" status and stop automatic withdrawals from my bank acct. I was never contacted and asked for a reason for my status change, and suddenly, I am reduced to only seeing 2 pictures, no matter how many a person has, I can't open my private pics anymore, and there are many other cants that make this site now NOT one of my favorites. Growr is infinitely better. I will probably cancel Scruff soon. It's become obvious to me that they are much more concerned with making a buck, than being good to the guys that are still loyal. There are way too many other options now. I hope they will read this, but, I'm probably just spitting in the wind.
A Once Loyal Scruff User.
title: A Little Disappointed.

review: Dear scruff, you app is my favorite app, and I appreciate all what you do for the lgbt community. My issue of disappointment is similair to other apps, is the circuit party scene and pride scene is more important than the community partnership. I have tried for the last year now to contact anyone from scruff and there is no possible friendly way to do so.  Our group which represents police fire and military members all over the globe and we wanted to form a partnership. There's a push and communication with other apps, and that wasnt what I had wanted. I am glad you promote and value community outreach, it would be nice for groups like ours to at least meet and see how we can work together since we do have scruff users and we are going towards the same goal. Thanks
title: Secretary, event coordinator protect and defend

review:
All of my previous reviews championed Scruff as an all around superior app, I wish that didn't need to change. 

I've been a paid member for going on two years now. I pay because it makes it easier to communicate with non-pro members as well as pro members. When a social app like this begins to segregate the paid members it devalues the paid feature set. Increasing the difficultly for any member to interact with a non paid member is a tactic for increasing sales that alludes to a lack of new ideas on the developers end. Paying for scruff allows me to have larger private albums -- I am not interested in this feature if not everyone can view the albums I create. 

Hopefully the folks at Scruff value user retention enough to focus and act on the current set of deplorable reviews.  I will be actively looking for alternatives. Should Scruff fail to acknowledge these issues relatively soon, they will likely lose my business going forward.
title: No Longer Best in Show

review:
Pros: Much more stable than grindr (which doesn't even work on the most basic level nowadays)

Cons: an absolutely ludicrous amount of basic features are locked behind "Scruff Pro", most of which are available on grindr at no extra cost. Examples: You can't see entire photo albums people share, you can't filter by age, you're only limited to seeing the last 10-15 messages or so of each thread... the list goes on.

I understand the need for incentive to get the premium subscription but these developers need to get real - the subscription is way too expensive, they're probably making PLENTY off advertising revenue from the free users, and so many features are locked behind the pay wall that many users (myself included) are just gonna flat-out stop using the app if this isn't fixed. I wanna like the app, but seriously, stop being cheapskates and give some basic features back.
title: Works, but developers are greedy.

review:
Scruff is way better than Grindr or Growlr. The layout makes it really easy to nab agate between profiles, nearby, woofs, etc.

The guys on there are also just generally the right combination between nice, interesting, hot, and sleezy, and I'm much more likely to be actual friends with someone from there.

Profiles have a bit more space and direction to talk about both dating/hookup interests and less sleezy stuff, and are easier to narrow down than the other gay apps.

A few things that big me though:
You can't scroll back in message histories. I get that you can pay money for that, but as someone who is young/conventionally hot enough not to need to pay for hookup apps, it puts me in situations where I forget a guy's name because I can't scroll back. I get that saving a backlog of pics maybe is too expensive, but saving the text part would be nice.

I also wish they sent push notifications for woofs, not just messages, because I often miss woofs guys send me for several days. The push notifications have been messed up lately anyway, they will not show a banner saying I have messages so I won't check and then will find I missed someone hot who wanted to hook
title: Love scruff

review: This is actually (kinda) the best among all the gay men's dating/hook-up sites but it comes with one major fault: you can only display one pic publicly at a time. That's mindless because someone might see a guy they're somewhat interested in but they only have one pic to decide to pursue it further or not. Jack'd let's one put up 3 pics PLUS the option of 2 private pics if one chooses to. I would give that one 4 stars if it weren't for the fact that so few men join it and it feels like Groundhog Day every time you look at the selections. Can't understand why more men wouldn't be flocking to Jack'd. But, Scruff has much going for it except that big Achile's heel. Maybe some out there is actually paying attention and will implement the simple feature of letting the guys know the full portrait of their prospective date. Sorta makes sense, huh?
title: Awesome but w/ huge caveat

review:
Very pleased with the rate of improvements to this app. It's currently the only one of its kind I use (ditched Grindr). I love filtering on community (though too many people are delusional about which communities they actually belong in--filter on "Muscle" and see what I mean), I love being able to organize albums and favorites better than before. I love the way it notifies you of new woofs and album unlockings.

I've met a lot of people in the real world by meeting first online, and how do you put a price on friendships? Yes, I will keep in touch with many of them for a long time to come. So this app has paid for itself repeatedly.

Update: the program has, after recent updates, been positively harassing me to rate it, and pestering me with notifications. I lowered my rating. Happy now, jerks?
title: Love the new features

review:
The app is continually freezing on my 6+, and taking inordinate amounts of time to load.  My WiFi signal is great, and my 5S has had little difficulty loading SCRUFF and images; much faster than my 6+.  Perhaps an update?!  

SCRUFF is pricy, and for the quality of guys who are generally found, I have remained a basic user because the app has not demonstrated the worth of purchasing.  Also, I have noticed that more and more basic features are being taken away (over the last year or so) so that users, who want those very features to remain, will have to succumb to a forced purchase.

Chiseled bodies (there's only so many 'good body genes' out there, and they're not the majority), "top", "bottom", "hung" and "cross fit" (or "xxfit") have been well demonstrated to perpetuate the divisiveness of the homo subculture through SCRUFF.  Realizing that we all have preferences, but we're also in the same canoe with paddles, and if we're not paddling in unison, we're not going to get far.
title: Alright and slipping...

review:
Scruff was a phenomenal app when it was first released. Good support of the community and a decent, if not great, interface.  Over time the interface improved, more guys started using the app, and Scruff started sponsoring community events. Things looked promising for the future.

Somewhere, though, the developers made some bad decisions. Deciding to charge out-of-touch high prices for piecemeal functionality is one such decision. Attempting to force such changes on the user base is another. Refusing to acknowledge just how disappointed that user base has become is yet another bad decision. 

Scruff has an opportunity to change course, but it will take some re-evaluation on their part. If they really want to support and embrace the communities the app was made popular by, Scruff needs to prove it. Otherwise, the developers simply come across as more concerned with milking money from their user base than actually improving their app's functionality and appeal.
title: When good apps go bad...

review:
You know that nearby mall that at one point was pretty cool, but now it's 75% vacant and the only patrons are scary people, and a few normal ones that wandered in accidentally because they thought it would be much better?  Scruff is like that mall. 

The interface is awful... Clunky, claustrophobic, ugly, hard to figure out. 
The majority of the guys on there seem just as bad. If you want to get bombarded with lame, one-word openers ("hey", "grr", "stud", "sup?") by guys who aren't smart enough or don't care enough to scroll down & read a few lines of text in a profile (and of course have either no profile pic, or a shot of their nipple, eye, or other random body part), then this is the app for you!
Oh, and to fully appreciate the true magic of the experience, be sure to pay by the month for it, so you can feel extra duped for wasting your time downloading the app and trying to figure out basic functions within the plethora of icons & buttons everywhere on the screen. 

Oh, and if you DO pay, please notice that the subscription renews automatically. It does notify you of that with one of the MANY pop-up windows that randomly appear, but the method of unsubscribing isn't in the settings menu as the window says (it's not a button you turn on/off)... It's a link to the iTunes Store that's buried in the terms of service that you have to hunt for.
title: Used to be just ok...

review: This is a great app but I've noticed that many of the guys list their status as partnered, in a relationship, married, etc. No judgment but it's a bit frustrating if you're a single guy and you're trying to meet other single guys. I feel like I'm at a couples retreat or something.  It would be nice if the app allowed you to only see or be seen by single people. Half of the messages I receive are from guys in relationships. My profile says I'm not into partnered guys but I guess they don't bother to read the text. Other than all that, this app has the best design and best features of any gay dating app I've used. It handily beats Grindr, Growlr, Hornet, and Mr X; those apps all pale in comparison to Scruff when it comes to features, reliability, visual design, etc.
title: Dominated by partnered guys

review: There are several things about Scruff that I like. To begin with I'll state that I was using Grindr before and I had just about lost faith in gay people over it. Then I discovered Scruff and I have restored hope. For whatever reason, this app draws in more mature men (not just in age, but mentality). On top of this huge upgrade from Grindr, it has great features: woofs let guys know you think they're hot and helps ease into conversation rather than sending that arbitrary "hey." The "I'm interested" feature is great for deciding whether you should pursue further relations with someone or if you're howling at the wind. And notifications are great so you don't leave potential prospects hanging for days only to find they've moved on. Love it.
title: For mature audiences only

review: I love that my profile is synced automatically among all devices. Also, being able to see viewers and share albums without paying extra is very nice. Overall, scruff has the best coverage and usage across north america by a kinder class of users, and ease of functionality among all the gay social-networking apps, from my experience. Friendlier group of users, especially compared to Grindr(all attitude) and manhunt(judge not lest ye be judged...). Growlr still has the most respectful and friendly cross-section of men, but not as wide a selection, and doesn't sync well between devices. My biggest wish is that Scruff would have a website that non-app users could use and participate in the fun, like Adam4Adam.
title: Best functionality...

review: This app was a Godsend when I first downloaded it. I was over the Grindr gays and wanted some real guys to talk to. Flirt with. What have you. But every update seems to not only increase the price for a membership, but decrease the accessibility and features of the app itself. It's getting way too complicated. There are so many gratuitous features, and you now have to pay to use the basic features that made this app so great in the first place (private albums without restrictions, more profile loads, etc.). This app really helped me find great guys to talk to and it had a great sense of community. And instead of continuing to stand apart, Scruff has chosen to conform to the norm and care more about making money than providing a service to gay men. Based on the Facebook page, it seems the money from this app is only going toward funding the party lifestyle of the app creators. It's sad.
title: Dropping the ball

review: I like the many different features of this app, mainly the amount of space per profile. With others like Grindr & etc, you only have a limited amount of space to write what defines yourself and what you're looking for. I also like the insights into their profiles; how frequent guys are to responding, what their sexual safety preferences are and what kind of men they go after, as well as the locations searches and pretty much most of the app. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because to access the entire app, it's pretty expensive per month, which I get that's how they make money but overall that doesn't deter me from giving them a low score, so yes 4 stars is pretty great for an app like this!
title: Better than most gay apps

review: The 3 stars is because I love all the cool guys on here. It's a million times better than the guys on Grindr but the program has so many bugs and is so slow! The keyboard is so slow I spend half my time fixing typing errors because half the letters don't show up and you have to type SO SLOW! I wish there were sounds when you receive a message instead of just a silent notification. I find myself hitting refresh on the message screen so much because it loads so slow, doesn't always save guys in favorites and sometimes says guys who live in my neighborhood are 5k miles away. Le sigh. Worth the price tag tho. Who can really complain when it's free but I'd pay a small amount for all these things to be fixed permanently.
title: Very very slow with tons bugs so far!

review: What was once a great service, has now become a huge rip-off! While I understand the need to charge, I don't agree with the ridiculous $8.98 per month fee, to use features that cost far less on other apps. This boils down to greed! I subscribed for one month to try it out, and it already has glitches. As for their claim that "Everything that was free before is still free" claim, I call bull. I could block people for free before, and now you have to pay to do so. Even then, the block feature doesn't work!! Rather than paying $5 for this, $4 for that & "credits", they should have ONE fee for everything and not exceed $5!!!   Back to Jack'd & Grindr for me.
title: Horrible Decision!

review: I like the larger size grids with the latest release. I think that's the only thing I really do like about the newest version. I preferred the more specific indication of how long ago a user viewed your profile rather than a range like less the 2 hours, past day, past two days, etc.  And why are you gouging the gay community so much for the pro version?  I've been paying for it for some time it's twice as much as growlers pro version and I am considering downgrading. The additional features do not justify the additional cost in y opinion. People like to feel like they're getting their money's worth and I'm not really sure that I am with the pro version.
title: Works great but I think pro is too expensive

review:
I'd like to see a pay-subscription that's ad free. I'd also like to see the nav buttons easier to hit, and locked in a frame at the top instead of floating/scrolling. it'd be nice to have the refresh button at the top. also, a full photo gallery would be a nice addition for the paid subscription members. the chat input is clunky and slow, and often words become misspelled. it's difficult to double-tap into the chat screen. also there's no quick way to get right to the pic. that's what I want to see. 

outside of that, this app runs pretty well. I find a lot of the chats get lost, and your session expires after an hour. and the profile views expire after a day. if you don't fav people, you're liable to lose contact with them permanently.
title: pretty good

review: better than grindr, that's for sure (especially in the battery drain department).  getting to messages is a bit of a messy 3 step process.  no real notification system if guys mutually are interested or if you get 'woofed' at.  you've got to somehow figure that out for yourself, I guess.  somewhat slow to refresh at times.  and the in app keyboard is slow and doesn't seem to auto correct properly.  DESPITE all this, it's a great app and I like it more than the more fleshed out grindr.  this app isn't a battery sucker and seems to just close when you exit.  GREAT!  i'd like to see a few improvements.  but it's pretty decent as is.
title: decent, could use a few improvements

review: No other dating app that's worth your while has as many features ‚Äî global top/new members, global search options with filters, Nearby/online view (think Grindr), detailed profile info options, public & private photo/video albums, Match feature (think Tinder), etc etc etc. Although the casual user may rarely notice this, some features or components of features require a monthly subscription. The, say, weekly BUY SCRUFF PRO pop up is largely nothing more than a minor nuisance. But I strongly suggest that you buy it because I don't want to but I still want the app to be great and their coders need to eat and stuff.
title: Features galore but freemium just-the-tip

review: This version is the best so far. Previous versions have been frustrating with lost favorites and messages freezing. Seems to be better so far. Love the new interface. Nice to be able to tell if a guy is online. I hope they come up with a pay version with more filters such as age, location, friend, hook-up, and LTR. It would be nice if they had a "cut or uncut" option. Everyone says this Is a hook-up app but I think it's for whatever you want it to be. So many guys get angry about what this app is for. It is the best app and man tool available. Thanks guys for making such an amazing app possible for all of us to enjoy. I'm truly grateful!!!
title: AT LAST

review:
Only two things I wish they would add..  Would really like to be able to add a note to the profiles of guys I chat with so that I can remember their names since so many guys only put a single letter as their name or use some really off the wall profile name. 
Also would be great if I could rate the guys I chat with..  Maybe a five star system or something like that. 
Other than that I have absolutely no complaints. They are constantly providing updates for speed and stability!  The Scuff team is awesome and are very active in the community as well. Love me some Johnny Scruff!!
title: Love this app!! Best app out there for men!

review: I used to like Scruff. But it seems as if they are issuing ‚Äòbug fixes‚Äô to push a new version into the store and to get rid of bad reviews. What has really gotten me is somehow they‚Äôve gotten the app through the App Developer rules with making the ability to use TouchID to unlock the app a paid, in-app purchase. How can a developer make money off a hardware feature they had no input into creating. I‚Äôve lodged a complaint with Apple. Developers should not be allowed to make money off hardware. They are free to restrict their own content to in-app purchases. If you allow Scruff and others to start making money off Apple‚Äôs hardware features then where does it stop? Maybe a streaming music app will start charging more money to allow you to control the volume button on your device. This is the road Scruff is going down.
title: New version to reset bad reviews

review: Not sure what all the recent complaints are about. I've had the app since shortly after it updated to v5. Has always worked great. Nice interface. Easy to use and read. I've never had issues with crashes. Notifications for chatting and other things are included in the free version, which is a big deal. It beats Grindr in every way, except there aren't quite as many guys on it. Probably because it's a little more "upscale" in its quality and seems more geared toward guys that want to actually get to know each other, with more extensive profiles, pics, and chatting.
title: Has always worked well for me

review: I use the Scruff Pro version and have found that I like it much more than Grindr, especially when talking with people locally. Overall, the app design is better and more responsive, which is why I don't mind paying for it. It has its quirks, but what software doesn't? Interestingly, I have found members of Scruff to be more responsive than on Grindr and I have spoken with people both near and far (something Grindr was not designed to do, so comparing the two in some sense is not apples to apples). Overall, it's a good app, and though a little pricey, it's worth paying a monthly fee to get the features found in the Pro version.
title: Good App

review:
As a former software products manager, I know what goes into the design, implementation, and support of a world-wide, heavily-used application. 
Scruff has a simple, well-designed user interface; for the most common use, scanning of profiles and communicating quickly, (the "Woof"), it rates an A. But behind this simple task, there are many segments with usage stats for the members, again straight-forward, easy-to-use. 
Another sign of solid design and fully-staffed support; Scruff rarely crashes and is one of the most reliable apps I have used. 
This 'picky' user gives Scruff, its developers and support staff Five Stars. 
Great men, too! <g>.
title: Best Designed of This Type of App

review:
I have to admit I don't pay for the app, and hearing how expensive it is I'm not sure i ever will! However, from a design perspective I have to applaud scruff for making some changes. The simple color change when activity happens (whether you've been viewed, woof'd, etc) is great user experience. The set up of the app itself is pretty intuitive. HOWEVER, I am confused by the little side bar that opens to the left of the app when you launch it, then I can't seem to access it again? What's the point? 
I've got to give props where they're due though, and scruff does seem to care about their users.
title: Not a bad design

review: This app is much better than any other ones like grindr or boy ahoy. It blows them out of the water. Johnny is a great guy, he actually has conversation with those who follow the people who use scruff and are able to enjoy scruff brings to the table. I've met more genuine people on here from not just the city I live but all around the world than I have in person and I'm a pretty outgoing guy who can break the ice. Scruff attracts great guys who know who they are and what they want, thus making scruff a great place to make friends, go on dates, and even find a relationship!! Thanks Johnny!!
title: By far the best social gay app!

review: This application is a fantastic way to meet guys whether local or when you're traveling.  The profile section allows you to put a significant amount of content which helps a conversation get started. The "would you meet feature " is great. An application like this could never replace interpersonal communication but it's a great way to meet guys initially and then meet them out on the town.  From a software development standpoint, the application works flawlessly which gives it a technical edge over similar social applications.  I've also met Johnny Scruff and think he's awesomely hot so that kinda helps.
title: Excellent app!

review: I've always managed to keep this app around because I find more men around my personal preference whom are bearded, more fit, tattooed and more of a masculinized type crowd where I know I'll meet some sexy men and I have. The only problem I have with this app is that I would like to delete all of my messages by using a multiple delete option or a "fresh start" button where I ca either start all over again and/ or keep the messages I want around just so I don't have 99+ messages hanging around that I will probably never further engage in conversations with. I just need a fresh start again and there's no way to do that.
title: Delicious app. üåàüòéüòç

review:
I downloaded it while laying in bed this morning and was only on it for about 20min!...  The app kept asking me to confirm my "Location" and it also asked to send me "Push Notifications" and I said yes to all of those!...  

I then got bored with the App and went to go and delete it!... While deleting it, the Scruf app was busy attaching itself to other areas of my phone, without my permission.   When I finally got the app deleted, it took all that information with it!...  Causing me to lose a huge amount of data and contact info from my iPhone 4S!...

I've now spent half the day fixing the damage that was done and also working closely with my cell phone provider to reset my service and recover lost data, because I couldn't even do a hard reset or turn my iPhone off!...  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS APP TO ANYONE!...  Download it at your OWN RISK!....
title: MAJOR PHONE CRASH!!!

review:
Love this app.  I wish your favorites and message list were not limited.  It would REALLY be nice if you could do a search by logon name, not just city.

The one thing that is a problem is that you are stuck with the same group of guys on your near list.  You don't get a complete list for your area.  You do a search for a particular city, you only get some of the guys not all of them.  I am trying to find someone in my city that I know for sure is on Scruff but I can never see him???  What is up with that???  Please work on the searches

Thanks for this site
title: Scruff Searches

review: Scruff is a good app. I like the global feature but it is also a drawback because I rarely meet guys in the global part that are okay with just chatting with someone thousands of miles away. However it is great to see the hot guys from all over the world. It does eat my battery really quick too. I like that profile pics don't take forever to be approved. Not sure I like having to go online to read messages or do anything with my profile. Just seems like an extra unnecessary step every time. It's free and a way to meet guys and see whos out there. The quality of guys on this site is higher than that which you are most likely to find on Grindr. So I do really like this app but there are some minor setbacks.
title: Good stuff

review: I give the latest version of the Scruff chat and dating app a woof and a thumbs up! I've liked previous versions also, but this version has the best features and is really easy to use. I pay for Pro, so I don't have to endure ads and I get all the features the app has to offer. When compared to other gay dating apps, Scruff has the best features: the ability to woof, private albums, match, upcoming events, venture, and more. All of these things put the Scruff app far ahead of the others. The free version is okay, but Pro is the way to go. Get the app and starting woofing today.
title: A Woof for Scruff

review:
The app was simpler and more reliable in earlier versions. The two latest updates are unstable. I installed the latest update in the hope of resolving the bugs in the prior one, but it only got worse. This is not an improvement. 
The app FREEZES regularly, sometimes in the midst of a chat, then it needs to be closed and reopened to continue; the text may or may NOT be saved.
There have been several occasions when the app completely CRASHES, and then I'm looking at a blank screen or the scruff startup logo, depending exactly on what, who knows?
Finally, the badge notifications do not always clear after opening profiles and reading messages. They used to, but not anymore, and the speed with which past messages scroll into Scruff's inaccessible junkyard is a cheap ploy to get more Pro subscribers.
title: Crash/Freeze

review: I really like the basic free app, have had a lot of great chats and fun with it. Because I liked it so much, I decided to give the "Pro" version a go, and it was a complete waste. Really expensive considering what you get (the only thing I found helpful was being able to re-visit older chats). Once I upgraded, I stopped getting my notifications regularly, and the swipe feature (where you can swipe through profiles without returning to the main screen) didn't always work smoothly. So my review of 4 stars is for the basic free app, which I enjoy, but SCRUFF is getting really greedy, and I will not be renewing the pay version.
title: Don't go Pro

review:
It ALWAYS locks on GPS, always keeps my messages and history, and I always send and receive messages without any headache. The paid version gives you access to all sorts of nifty archiving picture utilities, but isn't necessary to have a good time. Essentially, this product does what it promises reliably an effectively. This by itself for me is enough for 5 stars. 

The community is also really great. I know that's going to vary by location, but I've largely only had good experiences, and I've met a lot of hot, fun guys on here. I LOVE that you can sort by community, like jock or student or leather.
title: A reliable product, lots of guys

review:
I like scruff because it is an avenue to meet and chat with other guys out-of-state and other countries.. In my state, this is going to sound cliche, but it is really hard to meet quality guys and get to know, and on a level deeper then just SEX.. I have been on other sites and I think this is the easiest one to find the kind of guy that you want physically.. But such as life not always on an emotional level.. Guys say on here, well it's a sex site... That's just not true.. You make the site out for what you want it to be!! Not everyone is looking for an instant hook up..I have found love on a website before and we were married.. I am now single and keeping my eyes opened for something real!!
Thank youüòã
title: Review from CT

review:
Simply fantastic, a responsive App is not only well designed but also brings together the best of a mobile world to our fingertips, networking! Having the ability to filter worldwide and connect with other guys is a truly fantastic experience as it opens the opportunity to establish great friendships.

The UI is easy to navigate though Woofs could be highlighted a little more as well as the "Would you Meet?" tool which to this day have to see working.

I highly recommend the App to anyone looking to connect with the gay community locally. Well worth the membership fee to go PRO.
title: An App for the Gay Community.

review: There isn't anything I don't love about ScruffPro.  The features are all great, especially the "recent" archives that remembers all the pics you ever sent and makes them super easy to access when sending pics to other users!  I also love that you can have dozens and dozens of locked pics.  I only wish it had two things that Growlr has: a place where you can blog, and the ability to send out mass messages to all the men in a defined geography ... those additions would be great.  I really have no complaints about Scruff.  I meet men constantly off this great app!
title: I love using ScruffPro!

review:
Honestly not worth using without Pro -- but a solid app none the less. 

First the good -- guys near you grids, ability to search in pro for charecteristics that - um -- some feel are very important for compatibility shall we say. Also I applaud their use of PrEP and TAsP as safer options. OK -- the bad, Most Woofed? Annoying. Most Woofed New? Catfish central.  

Ultimately they may be trying to do too much. Already head and shoulders above similar apps, I don't need it to make a soufle for me (places to stay, city guides, ambassadors) - I need it to locate the folks I wanna -- locate. Well worth $9-12 a month for Pro. They've done a very good ob -- they deserve it.
title: Pro is a must -- But Scale Back Please!

review: I use this app and another similar app. Scruff is much more reliable than the other one, which is full of bugs and quirks and service interruptions. I often have problems sending messages on the other app I use - it tends to have "message failed" situations on a regular basis. Not with Scruff! The only feature the other app offers that I wish were available on Scruff is the ability to save commonly used phrases so you don't have to type the same thing time & again to different guys. Otherwise, Scruff beats the other app hands-down!
title: Reliable

review: I love Scruff, and even pay to have Scruff Pro.  It is the best gay social/dating app I have found, very easy to use, smooth design and layout, mostly free of tech issues(way better than Grindr), accepting of diversity of men using the app, and allows plenty of space to share about yourself and create a genuine profile including pictures.  I have talked with many very friendly people around the country via Scruff, as well as met guys that have become some of my closest friends and partners.  It is an excellent app for travelers!  I highly recommend Scruff over any of the other "gay men" apps.
title: Best Gay Social App!

review: Great app BUT could be nearly perfect If You Added a way user can jot short notes for their own eyes only, for guys' profiles - much as you can on standard online "social" apps, e.g., Manhunt -- even if just a sentence or a few key words for reference - it would solve more than one issue and put this app, over-the-top... I'm sure it's not so simple or the function would exist, but these days, everything is do-able if willing to find a solution, even if it does not presently exist... Still kicks Grindr's lame first try tho... Good job so far - don't get bloated and lazy like they have... Bring us Notes Please.
title: Just missing One function:

review: idk what these old men are cryin about. The new Match feature is awesome. It's one of the few features other apps had that Scruff did not. Now Scruff is better than all of the rest imho, as it was already pre-update. It got rid of the 'maybe' option which was basically useless anyway. Now with Match integrated into the yes/no options for 'Would you like to meet', I'm guessing a lot more ppl would use the WYLTM now that they're tied. You can also filter on who would like to meet you. Everything they've done makes sense. If it's not for you then move on!!
title: Feb Update

review:
I loved this app when it first came out.  There have been a lot of changes for the better, but it's just not the quality it was before, and I don't like being told to pay for something I can get for free somewhere else (i.e. Grindr, Growlr, etc.). 

Something I would like to see is a filter option.  I'm sure we would be asked to pay for that too.  It just gets old sorting through age groups.  I also get really annoyed at all the "partnered" guys on it.  It would be much better if I could filter out all the "happily" partnered guys so I could actually get to converse with someone available.  

A search option would be nice too.  Sadly, right now the only way there is to search is by city.  

I've also had problems with messages not showing up, and taking forever to come through.  Perhaps less time spend on celebrity PR and more time providing a quality product would be good for this app's image.  It's a great app, but still lacking quite a bit, and sadly losing ground.
title: Used to be better

review:
What's on Scruff: fur, beards, bears, men, daddies, boys, slim, chub, muscle -- all the scruffy things the original gay scene put down or devalued. Plus anyone of ANY description who likes any of the above.

What's common on Scruff: brains, conversation, raw sex, nonkink, light kink, heavy kink, tops, bottoms, versatiles, private nude pix, hot hot HOT private conversations, self-respect. 

What's NOT on Scruff: guys who are looking to put guys down ("go to the gym, dude!" "wax your back, man!"), femmetalk ("look at HER, Mary"), profiles that say "no fats or femmes", "generous" men or cuties who hint about money... Scruffers have their preferences and state them, but are respectful of guys whose preferences are different.
title: Great way to meet the non-stereotyped guys

review: First of all, I must admit I've never used Grindr, so I can't compare Scruff with it. But I'm impressed by Scruff already. Though it still needs some basic features like browsing through profiles and searching with different criteria (handle/age), etc, but I'm sure it is coming in the updated versions.. I've been using it a few hours and I love this one already.. Plenty of eye candy, and will be even better when more guys get to know of this app, and start using it.. Thank you, Eric!
title: Good, but still needs some features..

review: I am reviewing the free version of this app. All though many nice features are reserved for the premium version, the free version already contains several convenient features that other dating apps lack. Location search is a nice one. The best aspect is the extra anonymity of your choice -- you are given the option of staying offline, or even deactivate your account (but not instantaneous delete it and can recover). Chat tool is very good. One biggest critique is that the app crashes more often than others.
title: App with comprehensive features

review: The Scruff app is loaded with features and easy to use. They seem to be always striving to make it better too. The chat is handy and its alert tone is recognizably distinct. Profile area gives plenty opportunity to share as much or little as you want. When I have usage questions, usually I can find answer in the Help or doing a web-search. One improvement that I could wish is same for any app: to have more folks on it and Scruff is doing better than some others. I hope they keep broadening their reach to broader, more diverse community.
title: Having good experience with this app

review:
This app has been so much fun... I've meet guys from all over the world. The kind words of strangers speaks volumes. Our global village seems more connected by our ability to reach out and speak to men close by and across the ocean. I've has been a pleasure to connect both in realtime and virtual for great verbal banter......I the updates have progressively improved and made it more user friend. I do pay for the arms consider it worth it for the added perks..........no ads, and expanded searches. 

I have gotten lost many more nights than I care to mention talk to men on this app. Thank you guys
title: Fun f...ing app

review: While I do agree with some of the complaints in other reviews, I must say they pale in comparison to what I like about Scruff. I've had numerous good hookups, met some really hot men, and I can't complain about being a free user and not receiving all the extra features because what do you expect? Only real complaint is not being able to see a guy's full album even after he unlocks it for you. If I still have to pay, what's the point? Only main complaint. Other than that, I don't depend on Scruff for a real relationship because it's a dating app, not a miracle worker.
title: Great if you aren't picky!

review:
I like the app but I've been contemplating whether or not to keep it especially after the some of the features were removed and now I have to pay for them. I don't mind having to pay a monthly subscription but these rate are steep.   I already pay for some of my other apps like Grindr ($30 for one year) and made a "donation" to Jack'd ($13 for one year) and gained full access for both after doing so.  I feel that having to pay $9 a month a total $108 a year is absolutely ridiculous.  I understand that programmers and hosting servers need to be paid but lets not be greedy.  The app is good, not great and I like meeting and chatting with guys around the world, but again not at the new rates.

I hope Johnny scruff gets his act together soon and reconsiders the rates.
title: Good app, greedy creators

review:
Overall this app functions well.  

The only problem I've encountered is I have stopped showing up on the Global feed despite my settings being enabled to do so.  Scruff Support indicated that there was no apparent defect and the Global feed is simply a random selection of enabled users.  Why I would repeatedly appear on the global feed and then all of a sudden stop permanently is somewhat odd.  I frequently made the most woofed in the last hour list, which abruptly stopped when I was permanently left off the global feed, so perhaps I should just pick up the pieces of my fractured ego and move on with my life...but I figured I'd vent in this review first :-P
title: Overall, App functions well

review:
This started out as a great concept and fun app. I guess that as it become more popular, good ole American style corporate greed took over. If you refuse to pay the nearly $9/month for a texting service (which, basically, is what this is), you are down to the most basic features. Any other feature that might remotely make this a more interesting app is a PRO feature - but don't be rolled by the word though, unless they mean pro scammers.

Tried to view who woofed at me? PRO feature. What's the point??
Tried to look at more profiles of guys in my area? PRO feature
Tried to read previous exchanges with people on here? PRO feature.

Sorry, I'd rather use my money on something that actually provides value and enjoyment for my money!

PS - reading through the reviews, your rating seems to have taken a nose dive from previously 4+ stars to just 1 now - probably because 0 is not given as an option. Occasionally there's the overly eager or overly chipper 5 star review with no info - useful or otherwise - for the rating. One can only assume those reviews are from Scruff's own people trying to keep it afloat. Sad!
title: Don't waste your money

review:
I read a 1 star review I have to respond to. He says he's a pro iOS dev. Well so am I. And I completely agree, the UI update is over the top and falls short of a really elegant experience. If this update was expensive I hope it's a learning lesson for all involved.

But does this app deserve one star? NO. It's still the best at what it is. Best community. Best messaging features. The Instagram links in profiles actually work now. The app prompts for feedback when it never did before. It's the same scruff but a little nicer looking. Sad we lost basic filtering options but oh well.
title: It's still the king of its kind

review: I've been using Scruff for at least two years now and have found it to be head and shoulders above any competing apps. It's rich in features, intuitive in design, powerful in search, and seamless in operation. Of course, the main appeal is its audience; it tends towards the no-nonsense, masculine, and, of coarse, scruffy. But my hat goes off to the developers who have succeeded in building a tight, streamlined, elegant, and robust app that makes it all the more pleasurable to use for connecting with other guys. This is the app that should set the benchmark for usability. Bravo!
title: Superior user experience

review: ...for another service that can deliver what I'm looking for at a mo reasonable price.
