Factoring in reliability -- that push notifications only seem to work about 75% of the time at BEST and regularly less than 50% of the time...this is (a bit generously) a 3-star app. With the new expensive (relative to the market) and complicated pricing structure that 1) does not remove ads and (more importantly) 2) locks out a good 1/3 of the app's functionality (including features that were previously free) it is now a generous 2 stars.  I'm willing to pay for apps and even app subscriptions when I feel that they are highly reliable and fairly priced.  Right now, as sad as it makes me to say it, Scruff is neither.  =(
title: Time to start looking...

review: It's a fun app, don't get me wrong, but could really use a few updates.  First of all, when guys leave an area they remain in the search result for weeks if not months thus reducing the number of real guys in the area that you can see.  Also, a search filter would be an excellent addition.  Messages take a very long time to be received and at times, no notification appears so you could have received one and not known about it.  Finally, it shows guys as being online, when in fact they are not.  All in all, it's good for some fun, but other apps such as Grindr are better for now.
title: Fun, but...

review: The latest update brings bigger thumbnails, which is actually quite useful. Nice having a TouchID lock for the app to. Having noticed any major bugs - still works pretty well. Generally a better clientele than THAT other app which has a limited space to write information and equally as vacuous patrons. I've had a few decent conversations on Scruff and even met people who were NOT after a hook-up - surprise, surprise. I find it most useful when visiting an unfamiliar city, chatting with the locals in a non-threatening environment and even meeting for brunch!
title: I like the update (am I in the minority?)

review: I don't have any problems with the functionality of this app. However the monthly subscription is way too much so I only purchase it maybe once a year. Also I've been flagged more than once for the same profile pic I put up of me in my underwear....no crotch shots or bare buttocks visible. Yet I can continue to see several other profile pics with racier pics than mine. Scruff if you are going to have guidelines you must have every scruff member adhere to them this is why I would never give your app five stars. Also they took away the "guys who want to meet you" feature come on seriously Scruff????
title: Scruff review your own guidelines

review:
It is obvious to me that the developers have put a lot of effort under the hood. With the latest version, speed has increase significantly on many aspects: sending messages, loading profile photos, navigation, etc. 

The addition of the check marks next to sent messages to confirm they were sent to Scruffs servers is a welcomed feature. 

I am really pleased with the improvements this app had made over the last couple months, and this newest version is by far the best Scruff app so far.
title: Major Improvements

review: I really love scruff, less pop ups and no pushy sales ads like several of the other hook up sites.  Each of the sites has specific people the one starting with a g is for LTR.  The one starting with A has fake guys to chat with you to promote their site.  I have more flake outs and stand ups on it, plus photo collectors. Scruff is real guys looking to hook up in ten emails or less usually.  I have extremely fortunate with my results from Scruff's site, jive people I would not mind having back in my home!
title: Easy to navigate and great looking men

review:
Scruff seems better than ManHunt and daddyhunt... But it does have things that annoy me.  I like filtering by what guys want (like daddy chaser vs daddy) but wish I could filter on other attributes (like top vs bottom). 

Haven't been able to figure out if some filters are used with 'and' or 'or' logic. Seems kind of random. 

The only sort is by 'vicinity' ... And since guys who show up at the top of all my lists are near, but don't appeal to me or don't  respond ... But they  never seem to log off so they're always 'at front of the line'..   Sigh.
title: Better than others, but could still improve

review: Love seeing how far away all the guys are. Set filters to show the type of guys you are most interested in. You can simply indicate you like someone or even send a woof without being offensive. If they are interested, they can respond. The ability to have a larger number of pics in a private gallery that you can lock or unlock at will. Saves previous conversations also, so it is easy to start talking to someone you might not have seen in a while. Great app. GO PRO, it's worth it!!
title: Ready for Real guys??

review: I guess I just don't understand all the complaints. I have flawless use of Scruff. Despite the massive amount of time I spend Scruffing I have never experienced an issue. I've met AMAZING men and I absolutely love how fun and easygoing the 3 Scruff founders are in person.  Pay features are worth every dime in my opinion yet if I was unwilling to part with the money every month the free (stop complaining if your not paying) version is MORE than satisfying. I've been soo busy Scruffing I just don't have the time to grind or growl.   Great app with GREAT users. Thanks Guys!!!
title: McScrufflicious

review: In the nearby section you can search by city to matter what country it was, and it looks like in the new update you took that feature out, which I like because I have friends in other countries, now if something happens to the app you have no way to find them if you lose history Yeah works just fine functions well and there are a few good friends, But for the most part it's not the fun app with guys that were a lot of fun anymore, Many nasty people blocking you just for saying hi and inquiring of their well-being, Then I find kind of sad, Scruff used to be a friendly app, But not anymore
title: New update is just okay

review:
Possible problem. Since the recent update, my phone acts up after opening the App. The phone will now auto close other apps, act like it wants to delete other apps, opens random ones, and won't let me close out any apps.

I deleted only Scruff as a troubleshooting technique and the problems went away. Please fix this as I enjoy the app as I stated in a previous review that can be seen below. 

I've found this app to be effective in connecting me with other like minded guys. I'm now friends with a few guys from around the world. These are ones that I have talked to on the phone, facebooked, etc. It's more than just a hook-up site if used responsibly.
title: Effective in connecting people

review: Scruff engages in censorship and routinely suspends profiles and members whose views do not comport with the ultra permissive gay "community" stances.  Think San Francisco liberals at their most vocal and hating of viewpoints other than their own.  Scruff is full of "open relationship" types, i.e., men who can't or won't commit.  They routinely contact us single guys just for NSA.  Most of these guys aren't attractive (which is the reason why they aren't getting any at home).   Even if they contact you first, if you speak out against open relationships and say "No thanks," the gay couple will report you and Scruff will suspend you!  Also, if your profile says "no partnered or guys with boyfriends," and someone complains, Scruff will suspend you.  So hateful and intolerant!  Scruff is disgusting and un-American in its censorship!
title: SCRUFF engages in disgraceful CENSORSHIP!

review: I love this app for chat and other things, but I wish there was one thing it could do. We all have our type of guy, right? Wouldn't it be great if there was a way that Scruff could automatically weed out guys from view based on one's own woofs and chat? I get plenty of woofs from many guys, but a lot of them are from guys I would never talk to. If this could work, we wouldn't have to search for our type manually; guys of our type would just appear. That would be preferred. Other than this one improvement, Scruff is amazing!
title: One recommendation.....

review: I have used Scruff for a while now and I like that you can chat with people all over the world,  put in travel itineraries, and manage your photos in a much easier way (an album) as opposed to other social apps, namely Grindr.  I have stopped using Grindr because of the constant ads and spam messages as well as the crashes and terrible service. Scruff is 100% better and they are continually updating but not whole overhauls that make using the app confusing. Definitely suggest downloading!
title: Great App!

review:
Greed had brought this company to put in the small screen of my iPhone unnecessary features that all they do is to crump my screen. 
Price has gone up. Why change something that was working just fine. One last thing, originally I paid to have commercial banners off my screen, now I still get their banners which bugs the hell out of me. The only good thing is one filter is been moved to the may page (online now). 
If I don't pay I can only see two pictures of each profile. Stop being greedy changing the app to up the price. The original app worked just well. I don't care who's the most woofed guy, that makes room for all those extremely vain dudes who just here to play games.
title: I hate the new version.

review:
I think scruff is actually pretty cool. The updates are pretty neat-o too. As with any other app it has it's moments where maintenance is needed. However, Scruff is one of the classiest gay social apps out there, that I've tried. I've had more "dates" using Scruff vs finding guys who only want to hookup ie: most other apps. Still looking for the right guy but using Scruff to meet friends and potentials along the way. I'm only 20 and I think this app is doing our community justice. 

Thank you Scruff - for raising the standard for our community.
title: Pretty cool.

review: I love the new features on the Scruff app.  But one thing is definitely clear...and that is people feel you have exceeded the price that they are willing to pay to use it.  We don't mind that you become rich and successful from your Scruff business.  We do however mind that you're trying to do it overnight!   I use to use Grindr and a few others, but I enjoy this app the most.  If they get updated and have similar features but are less expensive, I would switch back very easily.
title: Great App!

review: It's great to be able to see the stats for people and know what types of people they respond to, how often they respond and which types they seem more interested in. The woofs are a great way to show a quick interest and if you get one back, knowing you probably won't be wasting your time chatting with them. I've gotten a few dates (legitimate dates) using Scruff. I also don't have to worry about whether people are into hair or not. Scruff is for, well scruffy people and those who like them.
title: Scruff Pro

userName: Walking on the wild side w/Tony
review:
Below was my 1st review of Scruff; however, they've done something Amazing--> they mange to take a great App and RUIN IT!!! 

I liked it so much I paid a few bucks for some extra features.   The additional ads are bad enough & should see the cost to users go down. Instead they require $70 a year to use most of the services that were free or very cheap.  

Sorry guys but no bears or cubs are worth $70 or more year. I think you've let success go to your head???

Your new upgrade lost many of my favorites.  Guess I'll go back to Grindr and the other free apps. Will encourage all Scruff users to do the same!!!!

----------
Best social network app for guys who aren't "Twinks".  I hit it off with over 80% of the guys I meet on here. 
99% of the guys are super friendly even if you are not a perfect match.

Has many great features, including the woof & global. 

Only thing I add is a location button u can use to tell the other person where u are. Also wish the chat log was longer have lost phone numbers & address not knowing it auto erases all but the last 25 messages. 

Overall I really love it.
title: Love Scruff

review: This used to be the go to app, but when they updated it to include "Messaging Pro" you now have to pay $4.99/month for some of the functions. $4.99/month is a little much to pay for a possible hook up, cause that's what most of the guys on here are looking for. I'm not even sure what messaging pro gives u other than the ability to look at older messages, and possibly save your pictures inside the app rather than your iPhone. I'd rather get "My Secrer Folder" which I only paid $1.99 and I can still keep all those x-rate pictures hidden.
title: Disappointed

review: Hot, real, guys and an interface that's easy-to-use is why I love Scruff. Have used it off and on for years, and Scruff is full of guys who aren't afraid of who they are *cough*Grindr*cough* and are willing to get to know you. It also would seem obvious that the developers of this app care deeply about its users health and well-being - there are often service announcements about pertinent events like pride festivals, entertainment, free testing, etc. in the app. 5 out of 5 stars! Can't go any other way.
title: By far, my favorite dating app

review: This is a half decent app, except when u have to be subjected to the dramatic, long-list queens that seem to envision this is a make-a-wish list for Santa. With boring us with what they don't want. Get real, be simple n direct to voice ur opinion ;) sometimes it is a little off with the GPS but overall everything works smoothly. It is a rip-off that you have to be "pro" to even have a full thought or it is not allowed **cough cough** trying to take our $ **cough cough**
title: Out of all the gay apps...

review: I once liked this app better than Grindr and other similar ones; but, now, it's not much good to me whatsoever.  I once checked Scruff out regularly; but, then, I started losing interest and came online once in a long while.   Then it was rarely ever.  Finally, I just deleted it!  The pattern just got progressively worse.  The same local guys, if listed were seldom online..   How could I blame them?  Maybe, I seem snobby, but frankly it gets tiresome lowering expectations and accepting nonsense and idiocy over time.  Most of these guys are not very interesting, sincere, smart, healthy, or any of the qualities I'd look for in a lover, friend or just a "fling."   Who needs it?  Not me!
title: Here comes that sinking feeling... Again

review:
Now you pay for things that common sense would dictate should be free. Old chats? Can't see them unless you pay. Viewing all your favorites? Fork over the cash, please. 

Now you have to have a password to log in? Does Johnny Scruff think we're all so irresponsible with our iPhones that we need to have another layer of security?

If Johnny Scruff would focus on fixing this app so it's less of a broken money hog rather than trying to shoehorn his way into crap indie films and promoting his barber's new haircut style...that'd be nice.  (He could also feature more than just the same tired type of guys -- or Little David, whatever his name is. Apparently diversity isn't Johnny Scruff's thing.)
title: It's gotten abysmally bad.

review:
I'm resending my review of yet another incremental update due to the fact that these guys don't seem to be listening.

I think it's funny how most of the 5-star ratings are touting the hot guys but don't address the actual app functions or pricing... Wonder who wrote those?

The free version is SO annoying with the constant reminders and popups that say you have to pay for other features... If you simply scroll to the end of guy lists or message lists in the free version, you _always_ get a popup screaming for you to upgrade, and the popup either has to be closed manually or you have to sit there and wait for it to disappear.  A huge, annoying time waster. The string of notifications on login for events and stuff no one remotely cares about is ridiculous. The fact that I have to enter my complete email and password every time I log in is absurd.

And paying an obscene amount of money on a monthly basis just to get a few extra perks and line the gilded pockets of the developers? Don't get me started.
title: Still needs major changes

review:
I did just recommend a friend join and have a lot of my friends. I do prefer it in a way over Grindr... But something about Grindr man... The mask? It is great branding... Scruff needs that. It needs a cool, it factor. Something mysterious and alluring, hip but not trying to hard, like The Facebook when it was The Facebook.

Also, it is so expensive. And I never got my discount!?! Which is not cool. I like the match feature. Dare I say I think there should almost be s hot or not rating feature, more like a list of qualities and insights, or info from other users, like how you are perceived...

Very good for giving info and sharing pics. Super easy there. Also like to flirt with woof or just leaving a trail or not.

I think this app looks so much better and seems to work well too. We just need some sort of it factor. Something spooky or surprising or a little deviant and weird, a new feature or and icon with a tag line... Or even like a mascot?!?
title: I just don't know ...

review:
has the features i want and the community is there using it. in that way it's great.

but the app design is spotty. the 'hints' feature is intrusive, repetitious and apparently cannot be disabled despite promises to the contrary in the Guide. And the only reason 'hints' were added, one guesses, is because the interface features are sometimes hard to find or identify or get to and people were undoubtedly confused. Strange since it's just the usual cruise site deal -- public and private photos, messages, profiles. 

So...hope they're still working on this one....good thing, just feels unfinished.
title: good but needs work

review:
Love that scruff allows people to be who they are. Scruff can be a social network to make friends, a platform to meet your next lover, or your pathway to lustful adventures. you can make your profile represent you, and express as little or as much about yourself as you want. 

Love that scruff has remained reliable! Core functionally is excellent, server side storage has saved me so much hassle over and over, and I have been delighted by good support for new Apple products.
title: Scruff is reliable and let's me be me

review:
*update: due to my complaints on my profile about the product and subsequent promoting of competing app, Johnny deleted my profile, so much for no attitude!  

It's an ok app, started out better than it is now. First frustration is that I can't to do anything any more without getting that little pop up saying something like "sorry you cant do that, buy pro for better access!" Sorry Johnny, not gunna buy pro when its been over run by non bears for non bears(or cubs or chubs or daddies). That's the second complaint, it's an app for bears and the like and their admirers but I keep getting msgs from the non bear crowd! 

Honestly am enjoying Growlr better now, sorry Johhny, props for pioneering it but you've gone astray with the upgrade ploy.
title: Just another grindr.

review:
I've met lots of great guys on Scruff.  I've met guys for smokin' hot hookups and had conversations and friendships spanning many years.  Thanks to the poly relationship category, I met a couple of great boyfriends on scruff who were open to having a married boyfriend.  

I find the interface easy to use, and I like the filtering tools for searches.  I think the match stack would work better with settings for which types of relationships you're open to, how far away you'd consider, etc.
title: Great App

review: It's Nice to have both a Grid of Guys in your Area and a "Match Book" to flip through, Combing the best of both Grindr and Tinder. This is the Best Gay Social App I've used. Has the Guys Nearby as well as Options to look in other Areas. The worst part about it are the Profiles with No Pictures or the Profiles with too Many..Creepy HornDogs. Other than that, it's like a Big Hairy Oasis, a Manly Mirage, a PapaBear Paradise... Ok, I'm giving it a little too much Credit but it still deserves a Five Star Rating.
title: Scruffy Pup Likes the Daddy-Sized Details

review:
When I fist got the ap it was my fav over grindr, jacked or even a4a.  However, the latest version limits you in every capacity.  I can only unlock for a few people at a time, can only see two of any given members' private photos, and can only see a recent history of the chats!  Reminds me of how cranky manhunt is... But at least manhunt has reasonable membership rates (ESP. When they have their 50% off sales).  

Please take my advice and give users more freedom, or at least give them a reasonable member rate.  I think most guys would be happy to pay about $5 a month or so... Just sayin, I'd hate for scruff to get as unpopular as manhunt.
title: Functional but way to pricey

review:
Good for online cruising. They really need to figure out a way to lower the
"Pro" price though. About 1% of people to ever walk this earth will pay $100 a year for an app. I started using this because I read it was transgender inclusive, but there's more to be desired in that department (gay cis guys will be gay cis guys I suppose). The app itself is groundbreaking in that it has a "Community" option for "Transgender" (albeit right next to "Leather" and "Hairy". Overall, nice interface, album features, messaging system, profile layouts, and user filters.
title: Good, not amazing.

review: This is nothing more than a troll site for old guys who want to collect pictures of young guys and a ton of young con artist trying to scam money. Within minutes of signing up, I was contacted by half a dozen guys claiming to be thousands of miles away in another state or foreign country and needed money for a plane ticket to meet up and other older guys with no pic or profile. 75% of the profiles are not filled out at all - or are extremely limited and vague on their info. A majority claim to be in a relationship or partnered and only wanting to chat or looking for a serious relationship - on a sex site no less. So if you‚Äôre looking for nothing more then chatting and a few pics, then this site is for you.
title: Total BS

review: I have scruff pro. The ability to have multiple favorites lists, to have an album of pictures and to search for names, locations, and filter by interests is great. And the few times I've had to ask for support, scruff support was very responsive. I've met some great guys on the app and am making new friends in our new neighborhood. I'm even pen pals with a guy in Kuwait! Definitely better than the other gay apps I've tried in the past.
title: Loads of Features, Stable, Supportrd

developerResponse: {'id': 94657, 'body': "Thanks for your comments! We're happy to hear that you're enjoying all that SCRUFF has to offer. Members like you make the SCRUFF community as great as it is. WOOF!", 'modified': '2017-04-05T15:16:30Z'}
review: Scruff covers men of all ages and backgrounds, but it also facilitates finding men with complimentary interests. Admittedly, the most common complimentary interest is what kind of face and body you each find appealing: a twink looking for a daddy and a daddy looking for a twink can easily set their filters to find each other. This is also very useful in avoiding unwanted sexual advances, making the Scruff experience quite rewarding and pleasant in general. It also means kinky men can find each other, which is the feature I enjoy most.
title: Scruff

review: Scruff turned out to be a huge disaapointment. I am glad I started with a 1-month trial subscription which I will definitely not renew. On iOS 6 the app constantly freezes and I have to restart my devices every time. I updated my profile and a few minutes later only the first line in all sections was there, everything else disappeared. Censored?! There was no reason for that. That occurred over ten times and in the end I contacted the customer support. My inquiry remained unanswered! And I cannot be refunded in case I cancel the subscription. Nice app concept but very poor performance. And the subscription plan is in no way justified.
title: Buggy and way too expensive for that poor performance

review: If you grow tired of a never-ending stream of twinkerific pics when scrolling through gay meet-or-hook up iPhone apps (cough Grindr cough), you've found the right app with real men. I've never felt limited by the free version, so if you think subscription prices are too high, you won't truly need to tap your bank account to use the app (so long as you don't mind only seeing a partial history of your messages). All in all nice app.
title: Great App, Great Guys

review: Love this app. Shows great men from all over the world or those who are close by. Pro version is the one to buy as it gives so many more options.  Only beef I have is the filters don't work. If I try to filter for those on line, just does not filter out those who are not.  Plus, I, like most men, am color blind so those little dots indicating on-line or off-line need to be in very clear primary colors.  Orange and green look identical to most of us.
title: It's the best out there

review:
Super-hot men are always 3,300 miles away it seems. 
But at least there are still super hot men in the world. 
Upgrade to Pro. It's worth it. I have text chains with friends that go back years. Awesome. Like going back through a diary sometimes. :-)
Good filters, too. Don't like always seeing the guy across the street who just ignores me. So, poof!  He is not in my grid. :)
I have 7 of these kinds of apps. Or at least I used to. This is the one I use. All the others deleted.
title: It's the TOP one.

review: Only thing missing is the one thing we want that every app will not give us that the websites we loathe because they aren't as accessible as the mobile apps are. We want to be able to search for 'preferred sexual position' and 'sexual act likes' and the right to want to have sex bb but only release that to people who do as well. Invisible only to those that confirm they do as well. To those that don't they remain completely in the dark.
title: Almost the best gay app

review: Not only is the paid version subscription-based, monthly, but even the features that should be standard like being able to scroll back messages from just a few minutes before become unavailable without being forced to pay to view them. I find the app screams for your money at every turn to have features paid for constantly, I find that rude. They are so desperate to have you pay monthly that I have been completely turned off by the application and I will  uninstall it. (Grinder too, has its problems, but there are more people and they tend to be a lot more attractive.)
title: Wants $ at every turn

review: Scruff started out good, and is still a decent app and certainly better for non-twinks than Grindr.  However, the recent add-on services are priced ridiculously high.  Additionally, there is no profile quality control (other rjan a rodiculois Nazi attorude toward partial nudityty) or review of users, so it is losing its niche amongst the scruffy bears, and becoming just another generic app.  I still will use it, but it becomes seems like it is becoming less and less Scruffy as the owners attempt to market out to a larger paying  non-Bear oriented market.  That's a shame.
title: Ok app - priced too high now

review: This is a good app. To be great...needs a few 'enhancements'. 1) messages take too many steps to retrieve. 2) drains battery 3) location takes too long to update. Should be able to request a location refresh 3) would be nice to be able to filter only others online in near tab, 3) should show date/time since last checkin & last online. 4) should be able to clear ALL messages at once.  Enhancements (if any) are coming way too slow. Maybe the developers are getting busy too. ÓÑÖ
title: Good app. Not great yet

review: Come on scruff developers! This was a great app, I've hooked up many times thanks to them! I'm really disappointed the developers allowed their system to be down for so many days especially now that customers are paying for features and are not able to use them! The least they could do was let us know they are working on the problem or give us a discount or something to keep our customer loyalty! I'd hate to see people move on to the other available apps that may not be as comparative but are more reliable...
title: Needs work

The techies on the team really took the time to get the functionality right; enhancing the user experience navigating the photos, favorites and profiles. Most importantly it's easy for anyone to communicate and still have the ability to look up old conversations going back 5 years. That's helpful for missed connections. I always recommend Scruff to all my handsome twink, chasers, otters and bear friends.
title: Scruff is the best gay dating app around.

review: First, Scruff is available for Windows phone and we are thankful. We use on our iPhone and windows phones to access Scruff. Second, Scruff is real men without spam. We randomly have used grindr, daddy hunt, growlr and others. We add/delete their apps because of the game players and BS, we never delete Scruff. Finally, the ease of use, many free features and ability to properly introduce ourselves in text and photos makes Scruff number one for us. Thanks!
title: We ‚ù§Ô∏è Scruff

review: I enjoy the selection of guys that scruff attracts more than any other app. The guys are friendlier. Scruff's capacity to browse outside your current area if planning a trip is another plus over other apps. Unlike Grindr, you can track if someone viewed you profile which I especially like because it serves as a way of knowing whether or not someone read your message to them or not.
title: Scruff is sexier and more responsive than Grindr

review: I do love this app but I had to make a new account recently with no help from support. These past few months I have not been appearing on the global tabs ( my received woofs dropped in frequency first world problems I know....) another user/friend had the same issue only to told that the global feature was working so we both ended up making new accounts. Guess what? The problem went away. To test if it were true I logged back onto old account and the issue was still there. Oh well at least the new account works.
title: Global tab

review: Apparently ad-free no longer means ad-free. You can disable the popover ads but apparently Scruff has some vested interest in other companies because there's a banner at the bottom of the page now which is basically the same as Grindr's free app. I appreciate the extra features, but don't advertise the pro version as ad-free when it really means "only the ads we want to show you". The #1 reason people pay subscriptions for apps that have free versions is to get rid of the ads. Everything else is a bonus. Lose the ads and then maybe I'll resume paying you $13 a month. Until then, be thankful you got a couple of years out of me.
title: Don't pay for "ad-free"

review:
a guy approached me on scruff telling me that he "only had fun with generous men" - meaning he'd have sex with me for money.  he approached me.  i called him the word for the world's oldest profession several times, he admitted he had sex for money and said he didn't care because it paid the bills and that he was 3rd in his med school class.  i reported him to scruff for soliciting money for sex.  and scruff suspended my account but his is still active.

so don't call anyone what they admittedly are or you'll get your account suspended.  but go ahead and solicit people to have sex for money and you're A-OK in the scruff playbook.

this most recent update was pounded out by 1000 monkeys at 1000 typewriters over 1000 years.
title: fools, and monkeys

review:
Scruff keeps issuing minor upgrades to purge the bad reviews. This is NOT a four star app but a one star app.  Go back and read ALL the reviews. It seems to get worse with each "upgrade". 

Scruff got greedy and ruined this app. The pay features are way too expensive. And now some of the previously free features must be paid for e.g., you can't view check ins unless you pay for the browser feature. Scruff lied when they said all the free features would remain free.

Scruff just keeps issuing new updates every couple of weeks to purge the bad reviews. This app Is expensive and offers nothing worthwhile.  I'm now using GROWLr and have already met several friendly (and HOT!) bears.
title: A miserable failure!

review: You can have profile information, see guys who aren't in your area, the "woof" system is nice for those who aren't super assertive (like myself) or just to compliment people you find attractive. Scruff feels like a classier version of Grindr with more features (for free) and better GUI and ease-of-use. 4 out of 5 stars because you can only see (I think it's 50?) people in your area for free and have to pay to see more. That's the only downside I can think of. Otherwise it's great.
title: WAY better than Grindr!

review: So Scruff used to be my favorite cruising app, so much so that I've been a paying member for over a year now (and I hardly EVER pay for apps, especially an expensive monthly membership fee). Over the last couple of months, though, I've become more and more disappointed in its performance. The latest update is likely the nail in the coffin for my pro membership. What little time I've been able to spend checking out the (lousy) new features between crashes leaves me unimpressed. Giving it a couple of weeks to improve, but very skeptical at this point.
title: Rethinking my pro membership

review: I use to really like scruff compared to grindr but now with the new update, I'm thinking they are after cash. use to be if someone unlocked their pics you could view them, now you have to be a paid member to see more than 2 private pics. scruff also use to mean all scruffy men but now it seems you have to be a muscle bear to be scruffy. too bad scruff you had a great thing going. I'm really glad there is still growlr.
title: not worth it

review:
This is pocket GAYDAR.  I love to launch the app in any new locale to see who's on my team.  There is a feature where you can write a profile that is tailored to your specific interests.  If you are the hook-up type or the LTR seeker this app let's you express yourself.  Pics and profiles upload easily and let you put yourself out there in with remarkable ease. 

I found that the profile is very effective at articulating what's on your mind, who you are and what you are looking for.

I check it throughout the day and have far more fun meeting, chatting, exploring or just peeking.  

Nothing and no app is perfect.  This one is truly taking advantage of the shortcomings of other similar apps - it allows you to tailor your message.  I recommend it and have had no problems with it at all.
title: Just a gay guy

review: I like the app a lot. An easy way to meet people via chat when people are busy to go out. As well as being able to meet people when you travel. I have meet some great people from scruff. The best part is not just a hook up. I like that a lot. Being able to meet people and get to know them from my own city as well as from all over. I'm a fan. I don't like the fact I have pro but I am always having issues and it's not showing up on my phone. Drives me nuts.
title: I love scruff

review:
Works very well. I like the user interface and being able to see who's viewed you. Nice set of guys as well. I also appreciate the continuing improvements, such as new and easier-to-use interfaces. 
Finally, I feel that much of the criticism of this application stems from peoples' hatred of both themselves and others in the online dating realms more than from legitimate, major interface issues. Thank you.
title: Thank You

review: This is the best app out of all the gay social apps, but you got it wrong with all the bugs and wonkiness with this release.  I can't update my profile because it doesn't save changes and I keep getting a TOS warning that I don't understand. The word "travel" must be too offensive. Don't be Grindr and fix it quickly.  I'm a paying member and my subscription is up in 15 days, don't make me cancel it.
title: Are you going to fix it?

review: This has always been the best gay App. Puts other apps like Grindr to shame. It very stable, works as designed and is great because you can meet men from all over the world. I have found the quality of guys on here to be better than Grindr also. And with the latest version things got even better with matching of other guys that are interested in meeting you. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!
title: Still the best

review: As a traveling salesmen I'm in different city's around North America. Scruff had helped me connect and stay in contact with friends from around the US and Canada. It's a very reliable app. I would recommend it to anyone looking to expand into the Bear and Leather Community. Scruff has an constantly supporting the community and the causes they represent. Thank you scruff for staying true to the bear and leather community. Thank you for providing a way for men around the world to connect.
title: Scruff

review:
So I've given it some time to give an honest opinion. This new update, has completely erased all conversations. Every interesting feature requires a 5-10$ a MONTH fee. If you don't want to pay, it's no better than the other apps...in fact it's worse!
On the other hand, I keep this app for two reasons: the guys are generally hot, and the amazing (always free n been there forever) feature of when you see who's online it organizes by distance. 
In summary, the greed is mind blowing,  and contains some frustrating glitches. 
My recommendation: go get Growlr...it's FREE and has the ability to have two lock/unlockable pics (even nudity) in addition to your profile pic!!
title: greedFAIL

review: Why is it that with every "upgrade" there are more restrictions put on non-paid users? I understand you need to pay your bills too, but at $100 for a year?!  Even $13 a month is crazy.  You don't even have an actual website based service (such as recon or mister.) No other service charges that much. As another review mentioned, you can get Netflix for half the cost and they stream HD movies, not just text and small res photos. --   Will the next "upgrade" restrict how many messages you can send a day?  -- Keep restricting your users and they will find another, more reasonably priced, place to chat. You are not the only gay mobile chat app, just sayin'!
title: Really?

review: If this were the only one of its kind, not sure i would give it 5 stars, but in comparison to that grindng app...well, there is no comparison.  Just the fact that it knows portrait from landscape is a plus, but the ability to view tracks and the light-handed moderation (as far as I know) make it infinitely better.  Admittedly, paying for the Pro version improves it even more; the enjoyment I get is worth the price.
title: Better than that other app

review: I highly recommend Scruff. I prefer this app over other apps out there. I've had both pro and without upgrade and both are much easier to use with great new features. I especially like the type of guys I've met on here. It seems that more mature, professional men choose this site. I've met some great guys and made some great friends along the way. Scruff gets a favorite star from me and a woof to its creators.
title: Best App ever... Woof üòú

review: Wow, an app that can save someone (and I can relate) is definitely locked in place on my iPhone. Plus the features are really good. I like that I can search other cities in the "near" tab instead of being stuck with my area. But, the fact that this app saved someone is awesome & stands out. Thank you Johnny Scruff for creating an app that is loaded with convenient features to make friends. ÓÅñ
title: Really good app

review:
I enjoy the app and how it has progressed over time.  I would like to see a clearing functionality of the profiles viewed/woof'd,  those who have viewed/woof'd my profile, and opened their private photos albums. The private album would lock on that other end.  May be that function could be for paying members only.  

Otherwise I enjoy it.
title: Love the App....would love it more with additional clearing functions.

review: I have tried Grindr, growlr, jack'd, hornet, all the other bs apps on the market to try and find local guys to connect with. None have come close to giving me the experience that Scruff has. Simple layout that is easy to use and flows well. Very easy to connect with existing friends and meet new ones. Definitely recommend. In addition, I haven't seen ANY fake "bot" profiles like I see clogging up my feed on apps such as Grindr.
title: Best gay networking app

review:
I like the overall view for the global and nearby sections, but the information sections on profiles is too narrow. I feel like I'm going to need to cut down my profile information. Also the area to edit is too small compared to the disclaimers about no sexual soliciting. It's hard to see what I'm really writing. 

I really dislike the new option to show what my sexual preference is and safety practices. I was happy to know there was ONE app that did not ask this- it made the site feel more like dating and you can overlook the hookup atmosphere.
title: Good and Bad

review:
This is still a good App. But the new fee structure is a bummer. And I hate that the services are broken up into separate parcels. Just give us all the features for one low price.
That being said the guys are great of Scruff. Not like the prissy queens on Grindr. I like that most guys have an actual profile and don't pretend to just be looking for "friends".
Wish that you didn't loose the beginnings if your conversations unless you pay. Would be nice if the GPS was a little more accurate.
title: To expensive.

review: The app is great and definitely serves it's purpose.  Have been able to meet similar type men and have had the opportunity to develop some strong friendships.  It may be someone who happens to live down the street or across the globe...you never know who you're going to meet and what will come of it...but that's one of the great features of this app and what makes it a pleasure to use.   Thank you!
title: You Can't Beat Having Scruff

review: To be to the point, it's my fav app. There are so many guys on here. However, being a relatively young looking 41 seems to have its curses. There should be functionality to search for guys within a certain age or "friendship" level. And why is it that when you search for guys in an area (nearby/city), they seem to run out. This does not make sense to me, as I am still interested in guys who live further than 2 mi/3 km from me. Still, I love the app.
title: Scruff(ed)

review:
Brings Scruff into iOS9 and iPhone + sizes brilliantly. 
*************************
Newest version fixes the few bugs I noticed after the 5.x release (namely the photo recall feature). Might I recommend a brief startup tutorial to show new users (and old) the settings menu? It would help with some of the complaints, especially the performance improvements when you turn off transitions and modify image download sizes. I feel many don't know those settings are there.
title: Finally Revamped!

review: Scruff has shown that they know how to build a quality app that is stable and feature rich. The catch? Quality costs. While all users will benefit from their dedication to making an app that doesn't crash or lose messages, like Grindr, and still have more free features (like free push notifications) than competing apps, the best features will cost you. And they don't come cheap, but they are worth it.
title: Best Gay App

review:
I really do love this app. It has great features and it seems to run a lot smoother than grinder. I love that it notifies you when you have messages, you don't need to be on the app for it to do so. Th features are great on it, very good for traveling and making new friends. 

I do have to say the one down fall I the price for some of the features is a little steep. I would like to see them drop a little so that they will be affordable for everyone.
title: Love this app

review: Much more user-friendly experience. And it's actually worth doing their upgrade options. You can let them run out any time and your account/profile remains the same, whereas with Grindr, the free one and Xtra are two entirely different apps and your messages, faces, blocks etc don't switch over. Plus no ridiculous pop up ads. And the guys are hot!
title: Better than Grindr

review: Scruff has been one of my favorite apps for quite a while. I was excited for an update and even planned on purchasing a premium app. But almost $10 dollars a month?! Sorry scruff, but he'll no! I was willing to pay a one time fee, or even perhaps a low subscription fee. Your monthly fee is way too pricey and the cost if sending pics is a joke now. I'm saddened that I upgraded at all. My Fave app just fell from grace. I hope you realize that you are expecting people to pay too much when there are other apps and websites that have the same features for free. As someone who loves scruff I hope changes are made. Sad face indeed... :-(
title: Regretting updating...

review: You really, really need someone who understands user experience to do a top to bottom review of this app and give you a list of things that need to be fixed--because there are a lot. Black backgrounds with small red text can be really hard to read. You can't tap and hold on a message anymore to clear the conversation. These are just a few of the many problems. And I don't need a global grid throwing the fact that the most woof'd guys are muscular white guys who look like porn stars--I'd already guessed that. And on top of that you're jacking up the monthly rate? Yeah, no. I'm canceling, this is too much, and none of it is good.

That said, despite Scruff's recent bump in the road from the last upgrade, I still gave the APP and service 5 stars.
title: Scruff Rocks!

review: This is very user friendly app. The features are well thought out and provide important functionality. My only gripe is the availability of the private albums. I wish individual albums were linked to the corresponding message thread and profile. As it is now, one has to back out to the main screen to see albums and may have to scroll through many to find one sent in the past. Overall this is an awesome app.
title: Scruff

review:
I recently showed this app to a straight colleague and we briefly compared it to his apps for straight folk. He was blown away and a bit envious. 

The breadth of options for description in a profile, and the multiple search options were particularly impressive. (I'm not familiar with other apps, so I didn't know there was such a difference.) Also, I find the app to be quite reliable.
title: Making straight guys envious

review: I've used this app for a couple of years. I like a few of the updates in this version; Placement of settings and color schemes / search features. Also like the venture although not all cities pop up even though I know some blokes there :)  it's been stable for me and I get my alerts. Using iPhone SE. I just use the annual plan. I feel I get more value out of using that than just the free version.  Thanks!
title: Good app

review: 100k's to a few million people paying 60-99 a year. Half a dozen updates since iPhone 6 plus and u cant bother to update to support the graphics and the keyboard takes up half the screen. Oh and now you show hiv pill ads even though I pay to not show ads supposedly  It's so trashy I can't deal.  If I could give half a star I would.  So much you have right but it's that kind of thing that shows you could care less. Apple is a 760 billion company now.  If you think they will miss u if they ban this crap along with grindr and tindr ur so wrong. Glorified GPS disease spreading. Ur the Marlboro of the 2010s
title: All those updates still not formated for iPhone 6 plus

review:
I'm getting so mad at app developers who extoll the virtues of their updates,  only to find they've taken away key features I've come to love!  Scruff, sadly, is no different.  I used to have access to all pics in a guy's private album.  Now I'm restricted to only 3.  Kind of silly & petty guys since even non-paying members can share an unlimited number of pics via Scruff chat!
So I decided to write this negative review.  But then I encountered another surprise--this review page was pre-populated with a 5-star, positive review!    So I had to delete it before starting this one.  Really Scruff?
Don't update to 4.0.  You'll lose features you love.
title: Don't update to 4.0!

review: Grids load fast, I like being able to have more than 1 picture (in my private album), and the push notifications are a bonus. But the best feature by far is the Scruff Insights rating, where the app keeps track of how often you respond to others or how ‚Äústuck-up‚Äù you are. Saves me from wasting my time with guys who don‚Äôt know how to communicate.
title: Great app, many features

review: Great way to meet local men in your area without needing to leave your house ! Weed thru the hundreds of men quickly and safely. No need to waste time on guys that you have zero interest. Allows you to focus on men that spark your interest. Once I've gotten to know someone via chatting I decide when to meet them in person. It's been working out great now for a few years ! Thanks Scruff !!!
title: Skip going to Bars ! Use Scruff!!

review: Overall great app. I would rate it at 5 stars, but the upgrade prices are seriously way too high; especially for the overall nature of the app (guys it's not that serious) Not only are the prices ridiculous but notice it's pricES and not price). Features are broken down into individually priced upgrades so that the user is paying too much money for basic features that should be included with a one-time reasonable priced upgrade fee (yes I hate to compare the two, but just like grindr does). Like I said cool app probably better than grindr.
title: Cool App

review:
I can say it's better than Grindr but that's not saying much. Free vs. paid version features are horrible. I've been flagged for inappropriate profile content on a blank profile and techs claimed it was for an email to an account I don't have. It made no sense!! It will suffice until the next better thing surfaces. 

P.S. It's is RIDICULOUS that you waste time deleting one message at a time. With the other amount of garbage on this app you think that could at least be one feature that was available (although it probably would cost you as well).
title: Decent but not great

review: I used to have this app. when it first came out and it was AMAZING. Unfortunitly like most apps they want more money so now you have to pay a rediculous monthly fee to use SIMPLE features like scrolling back through a conversation. Also the server is always down so half the time it doesn't work correctly. The developers might want to have a solid working app. before they charge us for basic features. I mainly use Grindr Xtra now. At least their fee is much less and I feel like its worth it. It also works all the time.
title: Used to be great! üòí

review: Of all the dating apps, I like Scruff the best for its design and features, especially for free users.   The success of such App's depends on the number of people who use it, so paid or not, the more active users, the more chances of meeting a match. BI also really like and have to commend Scruff for its community mindedness for offering lgbt orgs free space to advertise.  This further helps build community and awareness on important topics of concern to to its users.
title: Community First

review: This app is fantastic I love it! On a technical basis, I think it could be slightly better in so far as being able to send your location in a map like the competition, and saving saved phrases. Both of those features are distinctively missing from the website. Other than that this site trumps all of the other apps for hook up anywhere online. Kudos
title: Great app, great people.

review: When I first started using scruff I thought what a great app that would bring everyone together in the bear community. However it seems as the popularity grew the original intent was flushed down the toilet. I am usually quick to buy apps but would rather give the money to a homeless person. I mean really at $9 a month that's just over $100 a year sounds pretty crazy. However as another person put it when you see the creators of this app at all the bear events that must cost money. Its also clear that Mr Johnny Scruff who isn't even a bear knows nothing about the bear community and should just stick with the twinks.
title: Here today gone tomorrow!

review: I actually prefer this app over grindr. The profiles are more detailed which is nice. You can save multiple photos on your profile without paying. It sends push notifications and you don't have to pay extra. Yes this app or for scruffy guys and the guys that like them, but anyone can go on here. I also like the woof and "would you meet" features. You can also see who viewed your profile recently.
title: Great app for the more scruffy crowd.

review:
Of the many apps I've installed and uninstalled over the years, Scruff is by far the best and not just because of facial hair...
It is stable, looks great, offers lots of tools and in Scruff Pro, even more tools like Insights which displays the persons telematics of the demographic they respond to most by age, level of body hair, community preferences, etc, so you don't waste your time chasing what will likely never be. It's awesome. Thanks Scruff!
title: The best Gay Dating app!

review: I have to say that Scruff is superior to Grindr is every way.  The design and features are cleaner and more advances.  The programming and server capacity lead to a faster loading and much less buggy experience. And the guys are nicer and more interested in actually meeting than just posing.  Gay and want a mobile "social" app?  Then forget Big Brother Grindr And join me on Scruff.
title: Scruff is so much better than Grindr

I opened scruff to chat with fellow bears and met a wonderful bear in the process. We went on a date once I was out and things took off from there. Now we are looking forward to spending the rest of our lives together. Thank you Scruff!
title: Thanks Scruff!

review:
I get that you need to make money, but seriously, this app has only been out for a couple weeks and now it has ads blazing across the top where it is really easy to accidentally select the ad instead of the navigation buttons. Maybe this is intentional so that the developers get more money from clicks? In any case, it's quite sad. In addition, the ads change with a flip-like animation that screams "look, look, I'm an ad, here to annoy you and ruin your experience..." Again more sadness.

It WAS a cool app. Now it's just sad.
title: The Ads are Sad

More functionality and features than all other apps of its ilk! And that's just tip!!! After you go for the full package, it's over, done, no need to look or try elsewhere! You can scour the entire planet and plan your orgies, hook up, dinner plans, parties and more more more! Scruff just doesn't stop with how much more it has in its pants. All men need to use this app. Even straight guys! For a plethora of reasons. 

*woof* 
*WOOF*
title: More is less...

review: I'm surprised by all of the negative reviews...I surmise that many of such reviews come from those with phones the equivalent of fossils that can't keep up with the updates. Wayyy better than grindr and love the swipe/match feature! I do think the price is leaning towards absurd and programmers should realize that by limiting features and user friendliness for non-pro users they are shrinking their client base and therefore the amount of hotties I can chat with üòû
title: Great App

review: Yes, we are all looking for sex and excitement with these apps. But I like this one for the normal ness, here I am born this way attitude of the guys using it. Either you click with someone or not and that seems to be the accepted truth on Scruff. Other apps come with attitude and baggage associated with the apps demographic or target market which tends to foster that unworthiness low self-esteem feeling that I thought most of us had finally gotten over.
title: Best community

review:
Fun thing about this app is there are plenty of cute neighborhood guys to chat with - and the interface is great. Would love to see a better control of active messages - perhaps the ability to sort them into folders based on global guy locations. Also would love a keyword search to have conversations with guys based off common interests. Love love love this app in that it doesn't feel too flesh based and it's nice to have real conversations with guys every now and then.

DXdLM
title: Great For Checking Out Locals But Could Use Some TouchUps

review: I have loved this app and have a great international network of friends. Unfortunately, the recent upgrade causes it to crash and I have not been able to launch this app for several days. Come on Scruff, fix this immediately. You should be asshamed that your technical people allowed this to happen. Look at the recent reviews! There's a problem!
title: Question

review: I didn't have any problem at all with the original version. I can't stand a single thing about the new version. The text is so large that you have to keep scrolling just to read a few sentences. When I go to sign off I have to confirm that I want to sign off with two pop-up windows. Is this necessary? It's confusing. Not user-friendly. And I like that the black screen before was discreet. All the flashing red on the street is like a big advertisement that I'm on scruff no matter where I am. I could keep going but it's probably pointless cause I doubt they'll change it back
title: Hate the new version

review:
Scruff was the best gay connection app out there. Intuitive, easy to use and to navigate. And it seemed to attract the nicest guys. 

The nice guys are still there, I'm sure but finding them has become a confounding, frustrating experience in the new version. You used to easily be able to search in other locations.  No more. It is possible, but not at all intuitive. 

Messages and woofs are partitioned by days and weeks rather than simply displayed in a chronologically ordered grid. 

If you add a filter, one aspect of that filter (e.g., jocks) is displayed adjacent at the top so it reads "global, nearby, jocks" so you cannot tell if all or part of your filter is being applied. 

I could go on but to suffice it to say the user experience is now almost unbearable (hehe). 

Never thought they could make Grindr look good, but they did. This is the IOS9 of Scruff updates. Horrendous. All the more horrendous because Scruff worked so well before.
title: Ruined a good thing

review: I live in a smallish city so the dating pool is very stable and small. I've made some great friends, had a few fun dates through Scruff but the greatest value is meeting all kinds of men around the nation and globe. The app's features are always improving and make it easy to connect without anything being clunky or unnecessary. The new stats feature is really cool for nerds like me.
title: Not great for dating but excellent for friends and pen pals

review: Finally! An app that is targeted towards my demographic! Bears and leather community. Yes, it is extra work to have to go through a person's profile in order to get to their message they sent to you. I am confident that they will fine tune this app with all of us suggesting the same inprovement. A friend of mine told me about this app. I was tired of seeing all the twinks that are in abundance on Grindr! I'm happy that this app was recommended to me!
title: Great app!

review: I am a paying member and prefer this app over all others available. However, I find the global aspect to be fairly pointless. Being able to see guys from 9000 plus miles away really worthless. Having the "most" woofed is a great feature if it weren't filled with fake Adonis like profiles. I used to love this app and even as a fully paid member am finding less interest in using it. If it continues in this direction I won't be re-subscribing.
title: Wish it could be more specific to the U.S.

review: Despite the apps leaning toward the hairy, stocky guys, or bears,etc, I still have this one after deleting all the others. I am open to all kinds of guys. I can find a lot of different guys despite the "Scruff" characterization of the app. A bad experience with unstable guys and general dissatisfaction eliminated all other apps. Scruff is the last app standing. It serves it purpose more than adequate . Thanks
title: The last app standing

review: When something goes wrong technically (as it often does), try to ask other members for help, or look it up online. To e-mail tech support is to embark on a misadventure in rudeness. It's amazing the snark they get away with when you try to politely ask for assistance in fixing a problem (as a paying customer!) The tech support agent most recently refused to answer my question about renewing my paid subscription, which had been terminated due to a glitch (on Scruff's end). As a result, I think I just won't renew. I can't stomach paying his salary and the salaries of those like him.
title: Snotty, snarky, unhelpful tech support / customer service

review: I have chatted with done really nice guys all over the world. However, the local population shown for those of us who can't and won't pay for this service is not only curious but questionable at best. There is no follow up on reporting people and from what I can tell no need to do with the ease of creating a different profile and getting back online. To bad there is no way to have a freak/flake folder so we can help each other out when trying to make new friends or otherwise.
title: Entertaining.....

review: I love the app and I love the community! Everybody is so friendly and welcoming. The only thing I dislike about the app is that there are too many features that are "membership only." If you have a long chat with somebody, it is all lost because you can only see the last 20 messages or so.  However, that is a small detail - this app is great! Compared with the rest of the gay dating/hookup apps, this one is definitely the best!
title: Great App!

review: Haven't met a guy from here yet. Too many guys on here take too long to respond. I haven't got all day. It's like sitting in back of a bus in traffic. You want to move on. Seconds feel like minutes. It's the same here only minutes seem like hours. Also the guys that are close by and on scruff are scattered within all the guys close and away from scruff. Like it really matters no ones going to respond very quickly anyway. Overall I give it 2 1/2 stars. Guys are guys and the best web site is not going to change the way they behave.
title: Not thrilled

review: This is a good app, but needs to be able to scroll from profile to profile instead of having to go back to the main page between each profile. Also, it won't hold my pics I use regularly...it might as well remove that heading because it meet has in the last four or five updates. It used to a long time ago.
title: Good app but needs more versatility

review:
I like Internet sites the best but for cell apps"Scruff" is the best out of them all!   I have used a site that gets more hits but I've met more men off Scruff. 
I also believe Scruff is more user friendly and yeah I'm one of those guys who like the woof feature!  I have also met two guys in person who used the woof feature before the chat feature.
title: The best!

review:
I can't complain too loudly about a (mostly) free app and service, and I don't begrudge the developers for wanting to make money, but‚Ä¶

The new "feature" that makes me retype my email and password every time I want to log on is really annoying. I'm guessing they either want you to stay logged on all the time, or this was an oversight that will be fixed in the next update. I hope it's the latter.

The paid upgrades cost more than they are worth.
title: Changed for the worse

review: Love this app.  It seems as of late that grinder Which is supposed to be a gay male hookup site,  Has more and more people on there that just  want to talk.   With scruff at least you have more available areas for your profile and your desires So it's easier to find out if someone wants to hook up or not.   Not to mention the men on scruff are just more manly.  One of my favorite apps.
title: Better than Grindr!!

review: The five star rating is in comparison to its peer group and that I live in DC. Compared to Grindr and Jack'd this is the superior app. It's more reliable than Jack'd and doesn't nickel and dime you like Grindr does. You get more features for free than Grindr. And while you'll see many of the same guys using all three apps there does seem to be more guys that use this overall. At least in the DC area.
title: Best of the bunch

review:
The best gay chat app out there, in my opinion. Very stable, no major or obvious bugs, and let's you do quite a bit with the free version. Also very impressed with the statistics feature for user interests. Requires hook up, but that's the fun part :P. 

Only downside is the limitation for free version users, but think I'll upgrade since the developers definitely deserve the money.
title: Great app - well developed

review:
The quality of the men on the site is impeccable.  The selection is also much greater in number in all areas (I travel throughout four states). 

The profile descriptions on Scruff are thorough enough that, if you read them, you can easily determine how good of a match the member might be.  

The site is dynamic as you can send "Woofs" to other members to let them know that you are out there and interested.  And I'm surprised that most respond with at least a thank you.  

Private gallery allows for video upload and even offers categories for your public pics.  

Whether a hookup or something more serious, Scruff will have what you are looking for
title: Best Site yet!

review: This app is good, I love using it and I know many guys rating it less starts likes it too, just some black out once in a while when texting but all apps have some issues. I like how you can have your album and save xxx pics there so don't need to have them on your phone if you are discreet like me. You'll like it the app, is addictive sometimes, hehe
title: The S Latino

review: I love being able to meet people from all over the world, just when you think everyone is just alike and that you know all the gays in your community, you can always branch out and meet new ones from all over, and it's wonderfully surprising how great many of them are! The app works terrific as well, and the Pro features are worth it.
title: Great app, great people!

review: So I'm purely writing this and rating the app (again) because it's the only way to get back into the app. (I say again cuz I just wrote this and got kicked out because my name had already been taken.) The "give us 5 stars" box is there when I try to open the app and will NOT go away, even when I tap the corner "X out" button (which is non responsive) or I try the "no thanks" option (which also doesn't respond). So I'm forced in here against my will.  I could usually get into that sort of thing, but not right now. Makes me wanna delete the app altogether. There you go scruff. You're welcome.
title: Nah

review: By far the best gay social app out. Also u have a lot more space and options to talk about yourself and your interests. Def recommend it, u don't have to have a scruffy face, but it helps ;)

review: Love the app! Lots of guys to talk with. I just don't understand though why in the message section, in order to erase a person from it you have to block them. Just because I don't talk with them at this time doesn't mean that I might not want to again. There should be an option to just delete them from messages instead of blocking.

review: The thing that puts this app above grindr is the woof and the ability to see who has checked you out. Woof is a cool quick way to express interest or attraction. And knowing who has view me lets me know they at least have me a thought. Thanks guys for making my life just a little more interesting.

I like scruff until this latest update. The features you pay for are way too expensive. I get the same thing from Grindr. Plus you have to pay even more to send retina images. $10+ a month is not a fair price. Plus they took features away that were previously free (i've not blocked too many people). I even wondering if paying for a feature gets rid of the ads? 

I would no longer recommend this app for this reason. Scruff gets one star today.

Additionally, this app is far too complicated! I like simplicity of Grindr.
title: latest update was a poor move

title: Love it

title: Want guys who amount to something more than just a headless naked torso?

review: I created a profile and was able to chat with a few nice guys but my account was eventually deleted because a gun was visible in my picture - even though there is nothing against this in their guidelines. I am proud of my military service and it upsets me that I can't show myself in uniform because there is a gun by my side while there are countless headless profile pics of men with their hands down their briefs. Being a responsible gun owner defending our country? Bad. Anonymous men with deadly STD virus looking for a "pig" to top him while his "partner" watches? Well, that's just harmless fun. Pretty disgusting app anyways, I'll stick with OKCupid.
title: Gross

review: So I really don't understand the bad reviews. This is by far the beat social app with most free features. The community is amazing and Scruff has literally tapped into a community that no one else has before. I'm sticking my loyalty to Scruff and all of it's wonderful scruffers. All the scruffy masculine men and great conversations to have. Thank you Scruff team for such an amazing app and keep up the great work!
title: Best Social Network!!!

review:
UPDATE: had problem getting app to start as well. Worked for few hours. Solution was to delete and install again. All my profile settings remained. Things working great again!

I see this is a new app and off to a great start. As others mention, a few refinements will be nice for future releases. Otherwise an excellent alternative to Grindr for my needs. Love it.

I have better things to spend $15 a month on than this app just to be able to have the functionality I once had when it was free. Wished I hadn't updated. title: Update is a failure

review: I very rarely can give a true five star rating. I honestly have no complaints about this app. I do find that the guys are very high-quality for the most part on here. A lot of people you can tell are actually people you would want to be just friends with. Of course if you're looking for something else, there is that too.
title: Perfect

review: First let it be said that Scruff is among the best gay apps out there for meeting other gay guys. This messes up who you are really able to chat with. Other than that, it's a great app.

review: I never thought I could say an application could have no attitude but that's how I see it. title: Make friends worldwide!!!

review:

Unlike Grindr being one of the oldest in the gay app game has given the maker of Scruff the experience to continually make a Gr8 app better with every incarnation leaving little to be desired.

title: Great app comparatively

Also enough trying to make Jonny Scruff a celebrity already.

title: Matching Feature

review: Scruff is way better than all the other gay apps. I used to like the cheaper price better back in the day... But I understand that with all the features it has, it justifies the price. You get way more info, more customizable options, and so many photo options. And I actually met the love of my life on scruff. üòç

review:
Ignore the fact it says scruff if you're considering not getting this app because you're not a bear. This apps
Interface and stability are far superior to that of similar applications, and its community will transcend your preconceived notions, I assure you. Simply put, it's fantastic, especially if you subscribe to the paid version. At least give it a shot.
title: Great app

review: This app is okay, but they are constantly limiting functions in order to get you to pay for the rather overpriced pro version. In the last update, they now automatically clear conversations from a few days ago, so now there is no way to keep track of what has been said. It's so annoying to install an update when all the update is going to do is limit functionality and not improve performance.

review: This app blows the competition away! And by sponsoring social events in many cities, it has created a community of guys who are really fun in the real world. One request: a 'you woofed at this guy X days ago' feature. Sometimes guys change their photos and then get back to you. Please?

title: Awesome

review: I enjoy Scruff more than other apps. I've tried traditional dating sites but I realized that it's the same guys everywhere.  Scruff has more features and a more diverse selection of guys. title: John in DC's Review of Scruff

review: Let's face it, online hookup apps are transactional, juvenile, demeaning, soul-sucking, unimaginative, alienating, self-defeating, and banal. They are also ruthlessly efficient, and occasionally yield mindblowingly intense real-world exchanges. This app has a solid UI, stable build, reliable UX, and a fairly cohesive offering of premium features at a modest price. Moreover, the guys are hot, and bless them, they seem to fancy me.  Woof.
title: The online gay social sexualizing app for grown ups

review: This used to be a great app but little by little features were downgraded or eliminated. The chat record gets shorter and the record of woofs and people you have chatted with shrinks. Pretty soon Grindr will be the better option. I would be willing to pay a readable amount for the app, but since they are selling advertising against a rather deep amount of demographic data, we should not have to pay and give away data. But given network effects if Anouilh people rebel they have no more market. At this point they are beginning to kill the golden goose...

Now they charge you for everything.  And, I mean EVERYTHING.  Want to see yesterday's messages?  Have to pay.  Want to see guys closeby?  Have to pay.  And it isn't a one-time fee, no, no, it's a monthly subscription--FOR EACH FEATURE. 

Vote with your dollars, and don't waste your money on this app.  It isn't worth it.  Get Jacked, it's way better and still FREE.

I've hit block on several profiles but they're still visible. Even if the features were fantastic and worked properly, the pricing structure is baffling. How disappointing.

Almost every change is now only available for PRO paying members. I switch back to the yellow if they don't change a few things in 5.1. Guys don't do that! You earn enough money with ads!!!

review:
$4.99/month to enhance the messaging capabilities of Scruff. $3.99/month to improve the ability to browse for guys.

Really? You expect us to pay $8.98 a MONTH just for the extra features? It would have been okay if it was a one-time payment, but forget it. Grindr is a bargain compared to this. Also, I'm seriously put off by the constant messages nagging me to purchase the premium features. Sorry, I'm not taking the bait.

title: User

If they were $3 or so I'd likely continue, they are nice features to have, but not at 3 times that price. And the update doesn't work as well - in fact, its slower and less stable than ever. 1) lots of cute scruffy men, but unless you are bears they probably won't be interested in talking to you. The guys seems to only attracted to the same type of men. They are pretty to look at nonetheless.

I don't understand why they charge separately for two separate sets of features. I have not problem paying one low price for added features if it's for good features for a good app, but the two different subscription options for separate features with no overlap is garbage. 

There are other apps with more features that aren't seemingly greedy.
title: Two different paid options?

review:
There is a big bug!
When I added some person to favorite, It actually not added anymore. Even if I pressed the REFRESH burton 'NOTHING CHANGED' (It absolutely not working at all!!!). But I can cancel a favorite and I can see it disappeared in the favorite list. So that means I only can erase someone in my favorite list, I can add someone favorite list, BUT i can't see and check that guy in the favorite list!!!! What a big bug!!!

The only way to find out about their inconsistent definitions, is to use the app until, eventually your account will be frozen, and only after multiple emails are you able to find out that its a non-conventional definition of a word in their EUA that has made all the trouble for you.

title: Good!

So they think you are looking at them and all you want to do is clear the convo... Scruff please go back to the old version
